programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan tries to seal the deal on a gypsy caravan, while in Brighton, the two Dougs look at a £39,000 luxury houseboat and an unusual 70-year-old jigsaw puzzle.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Brighton, Doug Senior and Doug Junior try to agree on a price for a vintage motorbike, while in London, Nathan and Debbs try to seal the deal on some antique church pews.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Berkshire, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Windsor and Maidenhead to help Nicki and Damien, and single woman Maria, find their dream properties. The couple have a budget of £800,000, but a conflicting list of requirements such as reserving space for a garden tree-house. Meanwhile, Maria is adamant her new home must be a stunning bachelorette pad.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two first-time buyers in Manchester. Interior designer Abigail Carpe is looking for a two-bedroom period home in the southern suburbs with a limited budget, while David Isaac has £235,000 to spend on a city-centre pad to share with his girlfriend.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: With help from experts Kirsty Duffy and David Bull, John and Carolyn search for their dream property in Devon which hopefully matches their £700,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At boutique B&B Halebarns House in Greater Manchester, owner Adam Saleem wants to wow his guests with an eclectic mix of healthy living and hi-tech facilities.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Aspiring glamour model Annierose Crone hosts the first dinner party in Coventry, and prepares a menu featuring sausages in the starter, main course and dessert. Her guests are cleaner and wrestler Joanne Edwards, pub manager Tony Jackson, chocolatier Chris Tabor and salon owner Michelle Russell.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Master chocolatier Chris Tabor hosts the second dinner party in Coventry, but his elaborate menu provokes some mixed reactions from the others, and he ends up falling out with pub landlord Tony Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time pro-wrestler Joanne Edwards hosts the third party in Coventry. Her risky strategy is to prepare dishes she has never made before, and the lack of knowledge shows when she manages to injure herself twice while cooking the meal.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Publican Tony Jackson hosts the fourth dinner party in Coventry. His guests have high expectations for his pub-themed event and while Michelle Russell thinks he may be the man to beat, Chris Tabor tries to spoil the evening by criticising every aspect of the meal.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hair salon owner Michelle Russell hosts the final dinner party in Coventry, and the evening begins with champagne in the garden, but the proceedings take a turn for the worse when Tony Jackson decides to irritate the other guests and Joanne Edwards makes a shocking announcement. The winner of the £1,000 prize is also announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Ramsay continues his battle to restore the failing Town's Inn in Harpers Ferry, West Virginia. After witnessing abysmal food hygiene practices in the restaurant, the chef is left in disbelief as he uncovers terrifying cleanliness issues throughout the hotel. Can he win over stubborn owner Karan Townsend and persuade her to turn things round?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Loudonville, Ohio, to rescue Landoll's Mohican Castle, a custom-built, multimillion-dollar hotel set in an 1100-acre woodland estate. Co-owner Marta is struggling, having been left with the entire burden of running such a large establishment alone. Can Gordon persuade her son Jimmy to finally take the reins and turn this business around before the family legacy is destroyed?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with a family who were looking for a seaside home in Broadstairs, Kent, and also revisit Tara Magee and Alastair Murray, who were struggling to buy their first home together in Edinburgh, despite having a budget of £600,000.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Our Favourite Snacks
programme.desc: Simon Rimmer and Sophie Morgan explore how crisps and popcorn are made, how crisps are marketed to us and the science and psychology of why many can't resist them. A survey reveals which parts of Britain eat the most snacks, and at what time of day. Plus, the UK's favourite flavour of crisp is announced.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester's 18 chimpanzees face upheaval when new female chimp Vila arrives from a zoo in Germany. Meanwhile, nine-year-old cheetah mum Kinky Tail is vomiting after meals, and her three-year-old daughter Safi must watch and wait as her mum is taken to the zoo's medical centre. Cameras also follow Asian short-clawed otter Annie, who recently gave birth to a large litter of five pups.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The work of police and paramedics in Cheshire, following incidents from the moment a 999 call is made to the arrival of the frontline police and paramedics. In this episode, a 20-year-old girl has returned home after a night out, collapsed in front of her parents and stopped breathing, while one man calls the emergency services to say that a naked stranger his mother met at a punk gig has fallen down their stairs.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Brothel
programme.desc: A return visit to a Sheffield massage parlour, run by a mother and daughter, which sees business booming for owner Kath, who harbours plans to open a second establishment. However, new premises in the city are thin on the ground, and Kath has daily problems to contend with, such as damp in the gentleman's lounge and a customer with a custard fetish.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with David Mitchell and Cariad Lloyd, taking on Jon Richardson and Russell Howard. Sam Simmons joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies' man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, she's looking for a man to become her 'plus-one' in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who are revealed to them one body part at a time. They then they whittle the candidates down until only one remains. In the first edition, Aina, a music producer from London, wants to find someone adventurous who she can have a deeper connection with, while Guildford-based designer Mal - who has dated men and women - is curious to see who she will be drawn to when all options are laid bare before her.(n)

programme.title: World's Most Expensive Cars
programme.desc: Six racing cars are taken for a test drive in the Arizona desert, while a Fiat 600 Multipla is sold in Monaco and a 1929 Duesenberg Model J goes under the hammer in Detroit.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Penzance, Larry and Neil are doing deals on a pair of unusual hand-painted unicorn sculptures, a 200-million-year-old fossil and a rare gold disc by Olivia Newton John.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan and his team at London Road have to deal with a grand bone china dinner service, an 18 carat gold bracelet and a tiny Cartier bear with a huge price tag.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting in London. While Kirstie helps newlyweds Daniel and Jennie look for a home in the north of the capital, Phil joins friends Cathy, Ian and Richard as they search for a pad in one of the world's most expensive and competitive cities to buy property.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit past house-hunters, beginning with globe-trotting Matt Rushworth, who was looking forward to settling down near his family in Windsor, Berkshire. They then catch up with Sheffield couple Justin and Deborah, who were seeking a bigger home, but had very different opinions on how to tackle the property to make room for their sports gear.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Kerr Drummond help Tony and Sheila search for a house in Norfolk, but Tony wants to live in the country and Sheila longs to live by the coast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the group head to The Ardingly Inn in West Sussex, where Steve and Karen Marvel hope their family country pub will win over their rivals.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Healthcare worker Bev Stewart hosts the first round of the dinner party challenge in Keighley, West Yorkshire, opting for a schooldays-themed evening featuring fish fingers, meat and potato pie, and jelly and ice-cream. However, her choice fails to impress hair salon owner Rebecca, computer network engineer Adam, sales adviser Philomena and business owner Charlie.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Computer engineer Adam Bolam-Peel hosts the second party in Keighley, West Yorkshire, and plans plenty of surprises - including Northumbrian pipe playing and a poetry session. However, picky guest Philomena finds fault with his cluttered house, while Charlie cannot resist goading Rebecca about her teeth.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Image-conscious salon owner Rebecca Saunders knows she is not a great cook, and hopes her entertainment will make up for that as she hosts the competition in Keighley, West Yorkshire. She gives mock makeovers to the guests, and they are all surprised by Adam's transformation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sales adviser Philomena Golenya hosts the penultimate dinner party in Keighley, West Yorkshire, and tries to impress her guests by writing her four-course menu in Italian. However, a broken chair and a small fire in the kitchen threaten to derail proceedings, until her Italian dancing proves to be a hit with one of the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business owner Charlie Walker hosts the final dinner party in Keighley, West Yorkshire, and hopes to impress his guests with a `stylish with swimwear' dress code and hot-tub disco, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks into the luxurious Lakeview Hotel on Lake Chelan, Washington, where the bedrooms are empty and the hotel's restaurant and ice-cream parlour are failing. Gordon confronts owner Brent's inappropriate and miserly behaviour, but is it enough to repair the establishment's reputation?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with Paul and his American bride Alissa, who were looking for a property in Windsor, Berkshire, and revisit Malcolm and Jenny in Wiltshire who wanted a welcoming and cosy atmosphere for their prospective home.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of pioneering veterinary practice Fitzpatrick Referrals in Surrey, where orthopaedic-neuro veterinary surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick and his team help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets using cutting-edge procedures. A three-year-old Newfoundland dog needs surgery for its bent front legs, and a long-haired Chihuahua requires a total hip replacement. A woman brings in her German shepherd, which has developed a painful degenerative spinal disease requiring treatment.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies' man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, she's looking for a man to become her 'plus-one' in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Dairy farmer Ben hopes to find romance with marketing assistant Alice, while classical music singer Zoe dines with amateur dramatics enthusiast Tim. The restaurant also welcomes Sara, who has been single for eight years. Could straight-talking animal lover and dog trainer Nicky be the right woman for her?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Baltimore, Maryland, where Denise Whiting has alienated customers by trademarking the word `hon', a term of endearment used by the local community. When she opened Cafe Hon in 1992 it was a roaring success, but as a result of Denise's unwavering business ambition, people started to boycott the restaurant, leaving her frustrated by falling sales.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Junior and Claire find a wallet containing $500, and decide to keep it for themselves - but Michael and Jay disapprove, and insist on setting up a family court to decide the fate of the cash. Comedy, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Manchester's Strangeways is one of the largest high security prisons in the country. For nearly 150 years this building has imprisoned some of the UK's most dangerous criminals. Here cameras look behind the bars to tell the stories of gang culture, penal punishment and the biggest prison riot in British history which led to the major prison reforms in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Franky is back behind bars but determined to prove her innocence regarding Mike Penissi's murder. There is so much circumstantial evidence against her, it will be far from easy.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Gang
programme.desc: Female gang members speak about their experiences, revealing the extreme lengths they must go to as they find their own roles within the male-dominated culture. One shows off the weapon cache she keeps close by for protection, while another reveals how she was seduced by a gang member at only 15, after which he forced her into prostitution through violence and manipulation. Plus, the `honey-trap' girls who set up rivals for robbery, the teens who hide weapons and destroy evidence for their gang, and the girlfriend left behind now that her partner is serving life for murder.(n)

programme.title: Restless Legs Syndrome: Desperate for Help
programme.desc: Documentary about people with a compulsion to constantly move their feet. It's a condition so severe for some that they want to have their legs chopped off. Cameras follow the pensioner who contemplates suicide due to severe sleep deprivation caused by his tingling legs, and the sufferer who is housebound due to the embarrassment of her wriggling legs.(n)

programme.title: Pompeii
programme.desc: A gladiator in the ancient Roman city falls in love with the daughter of a wealthy merchant, who is being forced into marriage with a corrupt senator. When the nearby volcano Vesuvius erupts, he fights to save her and escape the destruction of the city. Disaster movie, starring Kit Harington, Emily Browning, Carrie-Anne Moss and Kiefer Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: A mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.title: Rails & Ties
programme.desc: Kevin Bacon and Marcia Gay Harden give powerful performances in this poignant tale of a train engineer who has to deal with a professional tragedy while trying to care for his cancer-stricken wife. Miles Heizer, Marin Hinkle, Eugene Byrd, Bonnie Root. Directed by Alison Eastwood(n)

programme.title: Jennifer Eight
programme.desc: Disquieting crime drama about a jaded LA police detective who transfers to a small town in northern California. He befriends a beautiful blind girl and goes out on a limb to catch a serial killer who, according to his colleagues, is a figment of his imagination(n)

programme.title: Sea of Love
programme.desc: A veteran NYPD detective searching for a dangerous killer stumbles upon a seductive suspect, who may be hiding more than what meets the eye(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three romantically deprived women all find satisfaction in affairs with the same mysterious, charming stranger but slowly come to realize that this man may in fact be Satan himself. This popular fantasy drama features an all-star cast and a script based upon the best-selling novel by John Updike(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: Thirteen is the new twelve in the third terrific chapter of Oscar® winners George Clooney and Steven Soderbergh's criminal caper series. With a stellar cast of criminal cohorts, it doesn't matter if it's eleven, twelve or thirteen -- it all adds up to fun. So ... are you in or are you out?(n)

programme.title: American Pie
programme.desc: This bawdy teen comedy centers on four pals who vow to lose their virginity by prom night. Jason Biggs, Chris Klein, Thomas Ian Nicholas and Eddie Kaye Thomas encounter some hilarious as well as touching moments on their way to the big night. Baked goods and band instruments figure prominently in the high-school high jinks(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: Brilliant scientist Reed Richards builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past. This reboot of the iconic Marvel superhero team stars Miles Teller as Richards (who becomes Mr. Fantastic, able to bend and stretch his body into impossible shapes), Michael B. Jordan as Johnny Storm (aka the Human Torch, whose body can erupt in flames), Kate Mara as Sue Storm (aka the Invisible Woman -- no explanation needed), and Jamie Bell as Ben Grimm (who is transformed into the rock monster known as The Thing). Directed by Josh Trank, who previously worked with Jordan on the superhero film Chronicle(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way: Rise to Power
programme.desc: Explosive action and a gritty atmosphere spark this crime drama, a prequel to 1993's "Carlito's Way." Jay Hernandez stars as Carlito Brigante (played by Al Pacino in the first film), a young hustler who rises through the ranks to become a drug czar in New York City's Spanish Harlem. But to sustain his power, Carlito must square off against corrupt cops and a smooth crime lord (Sean Combs). Luis Guzman(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Angelina Jolie stars as sexy Lara Croft in this high-tech action fantasy, based on the popular video game. The aristocratic adventuress battles a villainous secret society as she races to recover an ancient artifact with magic powers. Jolie's real-life father, Jon Voight, costars as Lara's dad, Lord Richard Croft. Iain Glen, Daniel Craig, Noah Taylor(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: A dedicated CIA operative in the field teams with a manipulative stateside agent to find and capture a Middle East terrorist hiding in Jordan(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: A desperate and crazed man, with the help of an accomplice, takes a local Brooklyn bank hostage with plans to rob it in order to pay for his lover's sex-change operation(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Kurt Russell stars in this action-packed thriller about a terrorism expert whose team tries to rescue a hijacked plane carrying nerve gas. Steven Seagal, Halle Berry, John Leguizamo, Oliver Platt, Joe Morton. Stuart Baird ("U.S. Marshals") directed(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Warped, crudely funny comedy about a boozy conman who robs the department stores where he works as Santa(n)

programme.title: American Pie 2
programme.desc: The entire ensemble cast from the original smash-hit sex comedy returns for this even more outrageous sequel. After their first year of college, Jim (Jason Biggs) and his randy pals rent a beach house for summer fun and games. When Jim learns that gorgeous exchange student Nadia (Shannon Elizabeth) will be paying a visit, he decides to get some quick lessons in love. Alyson Hannigan, Chris Klein(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Conor O'Neill is usually one step ahead of the loan sharks. But this time, his debts force him to accept a job coaching tough Chicago kids. Conor plans to take the money and run, but when the team starts looking up to him, he realises he'll have to take responsibility for the first time in his life(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: A mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: Halle Berry's Oscar-winning performance highlights this wrenching tale about racism, redemption and the power of love. She plays a poor Southerner who falls for a prison guard (Billy Bob Thornton) following the execution of her husband (played by rapper Sean Combs). Peter Boyle, Heath Ledger(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: A widow poses as a nanny to seek revenge against a new mother, who does not know that their pasts are intertwined(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: The hands-down best of the Bruce Lee kung fu vehicles, Enter the Dragon finds Lee infiltrating the island stronghold of suspected drug kingpin Shih Kien. Ostensibly on the island to enter a martial arts contest, Lee finds himself matched against Kien's fiercest henchman, Bob Wall. He kills Wall, but is unable to escape the many booby traps festooning the island. The final battle royale pits Lee against Kien, and Lee's former army buddy John Saxon against the formidable Yang Tse. There's more to the plot than that, of course, but action fans of 1973 weren't interested in the intrigues--they wanted to "cut to the chase" and revel in Bruce Lee's split-second chopsocky technique. Enter the Dragon is so good that it even survives the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker parody in Kentucky Fried Movie (1977)(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: After being left at the altar, a singer tries to piece his life back together with a waitress in this romantic comedy set in 1985(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: In this installment of the "Vacation" series, the youngest son of the Griswold clan, now grown with a family of his own, sets out to recreate a cross-country road trip from his youth to an amusement park(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: After being discharged from the Army, Brian Flanagan (Tom Cruise) moves back to Queens and takes a job in a bar run by Doug Coughlin (Bryan Brown), who teaches Brian the fine art of bartending. Brian quickly becomes a patron favorite with his flashy drink-mixing style. Brian adopts his mentor's cynical philosophy on life and goes for the money. He leaves his artist girlfriend Jordan Mooney (Elisabeth Shue) for Bonnie (Lisa Banes), a wealthy, high-powered executive. Brian soon must chose between the two, as he evaluates his options. Scriptwriter Heywood Gould displayed his sense of humor when assigning the character name "Mr. Mooney" to Lucille Ball's real-life son-in-law, actor Laurence Luckenbill. Television fans of The Lucy Show will recall Mr. Mooney, played by Gale Gordon, as Lucy's fussy financial boss. The film is more memorable for the 17-song soundtrack and plays like a series of MTV videos. Cocktail was a big draw at the box office in 1988(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Director John Woo brings Hong Kong-style martial arts action to this comic book-flavored sequel that eschews the complicated plot and political maneuverings of its predecessor in favor of pure, adrenaline-charged thrills. Tom Cruise returns as Ethan Hunt, an operative for the top-secret government agency IMF (Impossible Missions Force). Fellow agent Sean Ambrose (Dougray Scott) has gone rogue, stealing a sample of a deadly synthetic virus named Chimera that could rapidly wipe out the world's population. Ambrose's plan is to sell Chimera to the highest bidder in exchange for shares of stock in the winner's company. Summoned by the new IMF chief (Anthony Hopkins in an uncredited cameo role), Ethan is assigned to recruit the help of Ambrose's former lover Nyah Nordoff-Hall (Thandie Newton), a gorgeous woman who left Ambrose broken-hearted and who may be able to quickly regain his confidence. Once he meets and spends a night with Nyah, however, Ethan is smitten, and now must both capture Ambrose and keep Nyah alive as she infiltrates a nest of vipers. Sophisticated disguises, gun battles, and high-speed chases are the order of the day, very much in the James Bond mold. Mission: Impossible 2 is based on a story by Star Trek: The Next Generation writers Ronald D. Moore and Brannon Braga, with a script polish by Robert Towne(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A scientist survives a mankind-destroying virus and struggles to live in a New York City overflowing with cannibalistic zombies that come out only at night. Based on the 1954 sci-fi classic novel by Richard Matheson(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of a prostitute's body behind a rubbish bin. As inquiries get under way, they uncover a seedy case involving the shipping of illegal immigrants, police corruption and virtual sex.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the strangulation of a college graduate who moonlighted as a stripper to pay off her fees, and learn that the girl's death is linked to insider trading involving a former porn star and her mentor. Jerry Orbach stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Three women dressed identically as the Breakfast at Tiffany's character Holly Golightly rob a jewellery store and kill a salesman in the process, triggering an inquiry that leads the team into the murky world of illicit diamond trading. Meanwhile, Mac and Peyton investigate the discovery of a mummified corpse in a condemned building. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam goes undercover inside a federal prison, posing as an inmate to investigate a terrorist group responsible for bombings worldwide, and Callen is given permission to pursue a clue to his past.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Castle looks into a mysterious death of a fan at a sci-fi convention, apparently killed by a genuine space laser, of which only two working examples exist. Away from the investigation, the event sees Beckett's love of the cult series Nebula 9 revealed. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The Machine dispenses its next number and the team searches for Ian Murphy, a playboy living off his investment portfolio who is suspected of being a predatory stalker. Reese breaks into his apartment and discovers dossiers on a number of women he found on smartphone dating apps, including one who died recently in a car accident and another who is missing. Meanwhile, Root learns that Hersh is looking for her and uses the Machine to try to engineer an escape from the psychiatric hospital. Jim Caviezel, Michael Emerson and Amy Acker star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Van Buren orders Briscoe and Green to reinvestigate unsolved cases, starting with the murder of a teenager 20 years previously. However, they discover much of the evidence gathered at the time has vanished, and the detective in charge of the case may have pursued an innocent man to protect the real culprit. An unexpected confession allows the case to end up in court again, but legal trickery makes a conviction an unlikely prospect.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man with a history of violence is arrested for the murder of his son's school ice-hockey coach, but pleads mitigating circumstances. Helped by a glib defence lawyer, he claims that he committed the crime while suffering from a previously unknown mental condition he calls `sports rage'.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Flack looks into the death of a paintballer who was seemingly murdered when his killer swapped harmless ammunition for real bullets. The prime suspect turns out to be a rival who was competing with the victim for a sponsorship deal, but finding him is no easy matter. Meanwhile, Stella tells Mac she thinks she is being stalked. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise, Eddie Cahill and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a navy intelligence commander responsible for tracking the movements of a Venezuelan politician disappears. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Kensi goes undercover as a highly trained cat burglar to stop a sophisticated thief from stealing antiquities from a Naval base. programme.desc: Benson and Murphy question a television producer when he is accused of molesting his daughter. Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay and Donal Logue.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Featuring cameos by the stars of genre shows, including Battlestar Galactica's Grace Park and Kate Vernon, and Babylon 5's Joshua Cox.(n)

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of four bodies in a jeweller's shop. As the two officers come to terms with one another, their investigation uncovers some sinister secrets and collusion at the highest level. The marines' commanding officer certainly has no intention of making the truth public(n)

programme.desc: Brutally authentic war action detailing the covert US mission in Somalia that became a bloodbath. While the troops on the ground struggle to survive an urban siege by thousands of armed militia, the chopper pilots are shot down one by one(n)

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Brad Pitt leads a tank crew in the final days of World War II in this war drama from End of Watch's David Ayer. The year is 1945. Army sergeant Wardaddy (Brad Pitt) is the grizzled commander of a Sherman tank. Determined to strike a decisive victory for the Allies in the European Theater, Wardaddy leads his five-man crew on a treacherous mission behind enemy lines. His mission complicated by the sudden appearance of a rookie soldier in his platoon, the sergeant knows that victory is within reach, and vows to achieve it by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone revives the character of traumatised Vietnam vet John Rambo after a 15-year absence. When Burmese soldiers attack the Karen village, Rambo is asked to transport a mercenary rescue team(n)

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Brad Pitt leads a tank crew in the final days of World War II in this war drama from End of Watch's David Ayer. The year is 1945. Army sergeant Wardaddy (Brad Pitt) is the grizzled commander of a Sherman tank. Determined to strike a decisive victory for the Allies in the European Theater, Wardaddy leads his five-man crew on a treacherous mission behind enemy lines. His mission complicated by the sudden appearance of a rookie soldier in his platoon, the sergeant knows that victory is within reach, and vows to achieve it by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich's blockbuster stars Dennis Quaid as climatologist Jack Hall; a lone voice predicting that global warming will lead to a new ice age. He is ridiculed for his views, but his fears swiftly come true when a dramatic temperature rise in the Antarctic causes the world's weather to go mad, with tornadoes devastating Los Angeles, Britain literally flash-frozen and New York first inundated by floods and then overwhelmed by a killer cold snap. A few survivors, including Jack's son Sam, take refuge in a library and Jack sets out on a desperate mission to save them. The action-packed film (which won a BAFTA for its stunning special effects) may have compressed and dramatised the effects of global warming but, disturbingly, the basic science Emmerich uses in the film to advance the plot isn't that far removed from the increasing dangers the world faces today(n)

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 1 2 3
programme.desc: The late Tony Scott's remake of the 1974 thriller, starring John Travolta and Denzel Washington. It's a day that the passengers on a New York subway train are unlikely to forget. And it's one that could rescue the professional life of subway employee Walter Garber, whose glittering career has been derailed by allegations of corruption. Garber is languishing on duty as a train dispatcher when all hell breaks loose after one of the Lexington Avenue line trains is hijacked by a gang led by the supremely self-assured, calmly ruthless Ryder. Ryder issues a demand for $10m and makes it clear that he won't hesitate to kill anyone who gets in his way. Garber and NYPD hostage negotiator Lieutenant Camonetti attempt to get to grips with the crisis but, as events progress, suspicions arise as to whether there's more to the hijacking than first meets the eye. Also starring James Gandolfini as New York's mayor and Luis Guzmán as a disgruntled subway worker who has joined Ryder's gang(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: Director Scott Derrickson's remake of the 1951 sci-fi classic replaces the original's theme of fear of impending nuclear war with current concerns for environmental catastrophe. Keanu Reeves stars as Klaatu, an alien sent by a confederation of extraterrestrial beings to warn the inhabitants of Earth that the biosphere is on the verge of collapse. Predictably, as soon as he emerges from his spaceship a trigger-happy soldier ignores his instructions and takes a shot at the visitor. The wounded Klaatu asks for access to the United Nations to deliver his message, but the Secretary of Defence, Regina Jackson, instead orders that he should be taken away for further investigations. Klaatu becomes increasingly convinced that Earth can only survive if mankind is eradicated..(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: A spaceship crashes on a remote planet and the survival of the stranded passengers may depend on a convict, whose special gift comes in handy when night falls(n)

programme.title: Tremors II: Aftershocks
programme.desc: When giant mutant worms infest the oil fields and start feeding on humans, a local businessman offers a reward of $50,000 for each worm killed(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Action thriller in which a conflict arises between a benevolent eco-warrior and psychotic businessman(n)

programme.title: Mimic
programme.desc: Scientist Susan Tyler (Mira Sorvino) genetically created an insect that would wipe out plague-carrying cockroaches in Manhattan. The predators, having done their job and being sterile, would then die out. However, three years later, they've bred, evolved, become more intelligent and have begun to stalk their own enemy - mankind. And to do so, they've become adept mimics. Guillermo Del Toro's horror, set in the city's disused subways, is one of the handful of monster bug movies that works, not just because they are so powerful and intelligent but because they could actually replace us with ease(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland(n)

programme.title: The Aviator

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: The Gene Generation
programme.desc: In a future dystopia where thorough DNA scans are required to gain entrance into every major city, a world-class assassin (Bai Ling) is assigned the task of eliminating rogue DNA hackers. The sun has scorched the earth, and now dense clouds hang above overpopulated megacities. Those whose DNA is considered unworthy are locked out of the cities and forced to wander the wastelands. It's Michelle's duty to ensure that no undesirables gain entry into the city, and she earns a substantial paycheck for doing so(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: In this haunting thriller, a young woman searches for her twin sister in an infamous Japanese forest beneath Mount Fuji where lost souls go to commit suicide. With the help of an American guide, she treks into the heart of the mysterious woodland(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: Assigned to investigate a brutal cop killing, Ray Tierney finds himself on a collision course with hotheaded brother-in-law, officer Jimmy Eagan(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: Al Pacino's gritty performance propels this saga about a former drug lord's efforts to go straight(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: A restaging of the surprise Japanese attack against the backdrop of a love triangle involving a nurse and two fighter pilots(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three bright young students venture deep into the Nevada desert in search of a notorious hacker, and discover they have been drawn into an enigmatic plot with terrifying repercussions in this mind-bending sci-fi thriller. Intrigued by reports that a mysterious hacker named Nomad has breached MIT's advanced security system and exposed its flaws, freshmen Nic (Brenton Thwaites) and Jonah (Beau Knapp) hop in the car with Nick's girlfriend Hailey (Olivia Cooke), and attempt to track down the elusive computer genius. Eventually, the trail of clues leads the three students deep into the Nevada desert. There, they finally come face-to-face with Nomad just before everything goes black. Later, regaining consciousness in a high-security government facility, a confused Nic quickly finds that the worst is yet to come. Laurence Fishburne co-stars(n)

Oliver Stone's screenplay was adapted from Ben Hecht's script for the original 1932 version of the film starring Paul Muni(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: Brilliant scientist Reed Richards builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past. This reboot of the iconic Marvel superhero team stars Miles Teller as Richards (who becomes Mr. Fantastic, able to bend and stretch his body into impossible shapes), Michael B. Jordan as Johnny Storm (aka the Human Torch, whose body can erupt in flames), Kate Mara as Sue Storm (aka the Invisible Woman -- no explanation needed), and Jamie Bell as Ben Grimm (who is transformed into the rock monster known as The Thing). Directed by Josh Trank, who previously worked with Jordan on the superhero film Chronicle(n)

Stacey tries to make Jack see the reality of his situation with Matthew, while a paranoid Steven tracks Lauren's movements. Joyce gives Billy and Honey some advice on Will's fears about living above a funeral parlour and Abi is furious when she overhears Ben saying some nasty things about her.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As a personal emergency strikes, Mo makes a heart-wrenching decision, and when Nina oversteps the mark with a patient on AAU, her judgement is called into question. Elsewhere, Essie's teasing of Raf results in a surprising revelation.(n)

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: New series. Father Michael Kerrigan advises a hard-up parishioner struggling to feed her family while, with his mother dying, he begins to experience worrying flashbacks of his traumatic childhood. Jimmy McGovern drama, starring Sean Bean and Anna Friel.(n)

programme.title: Election 2017 Where You Live
programme.sub-title: Election 2017 Where You Live - BBC London.
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts as an audience of Londoners question a panel of leading politicians on their ideas to solve the biggest issues facing the capital.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Rangan Chatterjee spends time with 11-year-old Kiki, who is 11st and at risk of diabetes despite having a healthy diet and being one of the sportiest kids at school. The doctor must discover why the boy can't lose weight and come up with a solution quickly to keep school bullies at bay. Rangan also helps 16-year-old Hoshi-Rae, who has an eating disorder and the consequent health issues are seriously affecting her teenage years. Is the key to her problems her Mum, Lisa, who has a history of bulimia?.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Keeley Donovan and a group of volunteers renovate vital mountain shelters in the Scottish Highlands, while Joe Crowley visits the Vale of Evesham for an asparagus festival.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a three-bedroom semi in Stoke-on-Trent, a Victorian ground-floor flat in Walthamstow and a terraced house in Aberdare, before talking to the successful auction bidders about their plans for the properties.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate packaging issues with food products, and assess why many people say one well-known product is too difficult to open.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms and then sells three things about to be dumped at a tip, before giving the profits to the people who were getting rid of the items.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid considers if he needs to see Megan again, while Rob continues to bottle up his emotions despite things heating up at the Hollins house.(n)

programme.title: !mpossible

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Michelin-starred Paul Ainsworth takes part in the culinary challenge, putting three home cooks through their paces including a test of their butchery skills. Sheree Murphy presents.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v James Braxton UK Antiques Fair.
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden goes head to head with James Braxton at an antiques fair in Leicestershire. They each have £750 to spend on items with the aim of selling them on for a profit, and the end result leaves everyone shocked.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: A party election broadcast on behalf of the Green Party ahead of the general election.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ore Oduba host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: The BBC Election Debate
programme.desc: Mishal Husain moderates a seven-way podium debate from Cambridge on the key issues between senior Conservative, Labour, Liberal Democrat, SNP, Plaid Cymru, Green Party and UKIP spokespeople.(n)

programme.title: The Met: Policing London
programme.desc: Detectives deal with a long-running turf war between gangs in Harlesden, where a young man has been shot, another innocent casualty of a violent gang feud. Elsewhere in Islington, Sir Bernard Hogan-Howe visits a grieving family who lost their son in a police pursuit, although the officers believe it was reckless driving that caused his death, while an officer with almost 20 years' experience leads his team on a pursuit to intercept a car suspected of carrying a gun, a last-resort tactic known as an armed stop.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Conservative Party.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.sub-title: A Question of Sport: The Highlights.
programme.desc: Sue Barker, Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell look back at a selection of the best moments from the light-hearted quiz, with clips of celebrity guests including Formula 1 world champion Nico Rosberg, former Manchester United and Coventry City striker Dion Dublin and Olympic cycling legend Chris Hoy.(n)

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: Since the beginning of the HIV virus epidemic, more than 70 million people have been infected and about 35 million have died of HIV-related illnesses. Chris van Tulleken reveals how the latest treatments mean that a diagnosis need not be a death sentence. He also looks at the importance of testing and considers whether HIV could ever be eradicated for ever, while Elton John discusses the initial stigma against gay men, a result of the misinformation and fear when HIV and Aids first entered mainstream consciousness 30 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts revisit their most popular furniture finds and presenter Paul Martin visits Nottinghamshire's Thrumpton Hall, a family home with an intriguing past.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: New series. Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville return with more investigations about food and drink, beginning with a look at products that appear to be shrinking in size.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: New series. Return of the culinary challenge hosted by Sheree Murphy in which leading chefs choose their perfect partner from three home cooks, beginning with Nigel Haworth.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: Red Wing, Minnesota, to Portage, Wisconsin.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his rail journey along the Upper Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota, and the home of Laura Ingalls Wilder, author of Little House on the Prairie. Picking up the Empire Builder rail service he travels to Winona, where he finds out how, in the 19th century, the US Army Corps of Engineers made the Mississippi navigable and how the river is maintained today.(n)

programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, with Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the latest two rounds of fixtures, which took place over the bank holiday weekend.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the historic kingdom of Fife, Matt Baker explores Tentsmuir forest and Helen Skelton is at Falkland Palace. Tom Heap investigates culling badgers.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Repercussions from past events lead to an ill-advised liaison and an evacuation of the Garda station, while Paudge hopes another's misfortune will help his situation.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their culinary journey through time by celebrating Britain's numerous food festivals. The duo reveal the fascinating stories behind the events and sample some of the dishes on offer.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Jonathan Scott watches the older orphans being introduced to a herd of wild elephants, and meets a formidable matriarch. Michaela Strachan helps break up the nursery herd in preparation for their release, but the move is disrupted when one of the animals panics.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Author and broadcaster Simon Reeve retraces the steps of British pilgrims, exploring the faith, hopes, desires and even the food that helped keep them on the road. In the first episode he sets out on a journey to Canterbury, beginning at the Holy Island of Lindisfarne off the coast of Northumberland, one of the earliest sites of Christian pilgrimage in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon start the second day of their bargain-finding trip in Glasgow, passing through Falkirk and finishing in Dundee for the auction. The pair then discover who has made the most profit from their buys. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Alex James, Esther Rantzen and Hal Cruttenden try to help London-based art consultant Maxine win a cash prize in the quiz hosted by Patrick Kielty.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: Authors Wendy Holden, Dr Kate Williams, Jenny Colgan, Noreena Hertz and Dreda Say Mitchell hope to win money for their charity in the quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ally McGrath creates an inventive fish dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed. Meanwhile, Angela Malik takes on the ancient skill of preparing sashimi, and defending regional winner Michael Bremner uses turbot for his meal, but which will impress the veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are live in Gloucestershire with the latest from the nest cameras, as well as reports from around the country, including a look at how a peregrine falcon is faring high up on Salisbury cathedral. Meanwhile, Martin Hughes-Games and Gillian Burke are on the Sherborne Estate, examining how countryside management practices can benefit some exotic British species.(n)

programme.title: The Chillenden Murders
programme.desc: Part one of two. The killings of Lin Russell and her daughter Megan, along with the attempted murder of nine-year-old Josie, in 1996, shocked the nation. One year later, Michael Stone, a local heroin addict and petty criminal was arrested, charged, and sentenced to life imprisonment. A team of independent experts examines details of the crime, and evidence found at the scene, then turn their attention to the case against Stone at court.(n)

programme.title: Later Live - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Brighton duo Royal Blood return to the show with songs from their highly anticipated second album How Did We Get So Dark, while from south London, influential electro-pop trio the xx perform tracks from their chart-topping I See You LP. New Orleans, bandleader and musician Trombone Shorty presents material from his Parking Lot Symphony album, which continues his style of hard-edged funk that employs brass-band beats, rock dynamics and improvisation in a jazz tradition. From Los Angeles, sisters Este, Danielle and Alana, aka Haim, play a couple of numbers from their upcoming second album Something to Tell You. Plus, debuts from one of reggae's newest stars Chronixx, and new country music performer Maren Morris. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: New series. Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: BBC Two's Newsnight and Radio One's Newsbeat team up to look at how the election and the parties' polices affect older and younger voters. From political engagement, to benefits, housing and where the future of Britain lies, an audience of under 30s and over 60s will debate with politicians and experts. Presented by Kirsty Wark and Tina Daheley.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: New series. The Bake Off judge takes a series of road trips across different countries in Europe, driving some of the most famous cars made in each nation he visits. The first episode comes from Italy, where Paul takes a six-day journey with a different car for each day, beginning in Rome where he is joined by Strictly Come Dancing's Bruno Tonioli.(n)

programme.title: Richard and Jaco: Life with Autism
programme.desc: Jaco Mylan is like many 11-year-old boys. He loves rugby, dancing and also has autism. In this documentary Welsh actor Richard Mylan reflects on his experience of raising a son on the autistic spectrum and discusses his hopes for Jaco in the future.(n)

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: Exploring the forests of the Yucatan Peninsula, which contain the ruins of the Mayan civilisation and a wide range of wildlife, including jaguars, monkeys and tropical birds. The region also holds a secret that is the key to how Mexico's people and animals are able to survive during the country's dry season.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: Documentary following British members of the Australian emergency services as they deal with accidents and incidents. In the first edition, a raging bush fire threatens three lost walkers and a British flying doctor is called out to save them from the flames.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville investigate confusion at the supermarkets over how to bag raw meat, which may be putting consumers' health at risk.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Culinary challenge hosted by Sheree Murphy in which top chef Amandine Chaignot puts three home cooks through a series of challenges, including how to prepare a `squab'.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: An extended edition from Longmeadow and the RHS Malvern Spring Festival. Monty Don plants herbs in his new herb garden and gives advice on how to divide ornamental grasses, while Nick Bailey demonstrates a simple way of making a pond. Jekka McVicar builds a herb garden at the Malvern Show as Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Frances Tophill highlight the best from the floral marquee and show gardens.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn present a round-up of political proceedings, interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: Photographer Claire Seville's father George left the family home when she was three months old, so a Leeds-based family tracing agency attempts to track him down. In an emotional encounter, Claire and her sister Sarah attempt to discover George's motives for leaving them behind.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Impulsive flirtation reminds Michael of his carefree past - and uncertain future, and Angela fails to calm a bereaved parent who takes the law into his own hands.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the history behind some of the country's most popular spices and explore how they have been used to liven up meals. The culinary duo also visit a chilli festival - with mouth-numbing consequences.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Michaela Strachan accompanies the six orphaned elephants to their release site in northern Tsavo. Meanwhile, back in Nairobi, the four babies struggle to cope with the loss of their mini-matriarch. Jonathan Scott prepares for action as four much bigger female orphans are separated from Emily's huge herd in the hope that they will ease the transition in Ithumba.(n)

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon investigates ancient routes and shrines across Europe that are still being used, trying to find out whether modern pilgrims are motivated by religious devotion or a sense of adventure. In the French town of St Omer, he finds piles of shoes left on the tomb of a 7th-century saint with notes pleading for children to be cured of their walking difficulties. Simon also visits the Way of St James, a 500-mile route that starts in the French town of St Jean-Pied-du-Port, crosses the Pyrenees, winds through northern Spain and finishes in the holy city of Santiago de Compostela.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon start the third day of their bargain-hunting trip in Dundee, before travelling through Forfar and Inverurie on their way to auction in Aberdeen. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Patrick Kielty hosts the quiz show, with Sunetra Sarker, Germaine Greer and Russell Kane using their knowledge and debating skills to try to help contestants win money.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a celebrity edition of the show, as string quartet Bond and composer David Arnold take on the winners of famous game shows for a chance to win money for charity.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Scotland chefs hope to impress with their main dishes. Angela Malik prepares a tiffin box featuring a summer biriyani, quail scotch egg and spiced quail breasts, while Michael Bremner takes a huge risk by using ox tongue as the centrepiece of his main. Ally McGrath devises an inventive take on the summer barbecue, using a new method of cooking potatoes to recreate the coals.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Martin Hughes-Games present the annual series charting the fortunes of British wildlife during the changing of the seasons.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton hosts the grand final of the pastry chef contest, with the contestants spending eight hours preparing specially themed desserts with an elaborate sculptural centrepiece for a party attended by more than 100 guests at Firle Place, Sussex. Judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin assess their efforts, and decide who is this year's champion. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent, Fitzpatrick and Lavender meet a group of men from a local publishing company, raising the alpha male stakes when the trio discover the exciting perks the publishers receive in their line of business, namely company cars. In the showroom, receptionist Carol tries to get to grips with the new office computer. Elsewhere, in a bid to save face, Fitzpatrick puts faith in his comprehensive knowledge of the company Cachet's home turf, with potentially dangerous consequences for everyone concerned.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: A comic look behind the scenes at the political parties, reacting to the day's themes, rows and catastrophes, written and directed by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.sub-title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway: The Final Countdown..
programme.desc: Part two of two. Engineers must construct and fit out a new station at Paddington and erect a great glass canopy to soar above the structure, while workers at Tottenham Court Road are building underground platforms and concourses the size of an aircraft carrier in the heart of the world's busiest shopping district. In Derby, a father and son team race to construct 66 trains to ferry passengers across the 30 miles of Crossrail line.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the final leg of his journey across southern Scotland from west to east, beginning by paying homage to the birthplace of golf at St Andrews. In Dunfermline, he learns about the humble origins of a remarkable philanthropist who worked on the railroads before making his fortune in steel, and then crosses the Forth Bridge to end his trip in Edinburgh, where he treads the boards in an unconventional adaptation of a play by Oscar Wilde at the Festival Fringe.(n)

programme.title: The First Georgians: The German Kings Who Made Britain
programme.desc: Dr Lucy Worsley examines how George II had to adapt to a growing middling rank in society - who were no longer content with being subjects. Affairs of the state began to be openly discussed in coffee houses, and the king and his ministers were mocked in satire - with George becoming an easy target due to his frequent absences. His wife Caroline went on to popularise a medical breakthrough against smallpox, but it was their son Frederick Prince of Wales who had the popularity the monarchy needed to survive in the modern era.(n)

programme.title: The Secret History of My Family
programme.desc: The latest documentary charting social history through family trees begins in 1890s Salford, where press hysteria and public panic gripped the town as rival gangs were pitched in street battles. Local magistrate Joseph Makinson was determined to stamp out this gang warfare, known as scuttling. This film tells his story and that of the gang leaders he came up against, and also learns about their descendants, revealing whether violence is still part of life in working-class Salford.(n)

programme.title: Cosmonauts: How Russia Won the Space Race
programme.desc: Documentary examining the Soviet Union's pioneering role in space exploration, which is often downplayed due to America's victory in the race for the moon. Combining rare footage and interviews, the programme profiles a selection of Russian cosmonauts - including Alexei Leonov, the man who performed the first spacewalk, who explains how he found himself trapped outside his spacecraft 500 miles above the Earth.(n)

programme.title: Storm Troupers: The Fight to Forecast the Weather
programme.desc: Alok Jha discovers how accurate weather forecasting came to be a vital part of military strategy, from the Great War trenches to The Second World War bombing of Berlin and D-Day.(n)

programme.title: Deep, Down and Dirty - The Science of Soil
programme.desc: Gardening expert Chris Beardshaw explores where soil comes from, and what it is made of. It is an often misunderstood substance, with people sometimes dismissing it as dirt, so he reveals it as it has never been seen before using specialist microphotography, and highlights what makes it so essential to life. Research shows that humans are pushing this precious resource to its limit, and scientists are battling to find ways of preserving it for the future.(n)

programme.title: The Secret History of My Family
programme.desc: The latest documentary charting social history through family trees begins in 1890s Salford, where press hysteria and public panic gripped the town as rival gangs were pitched in street battles. Local magistrate Joseph Makinson was determined to stamp out this gang warfare, known as scuttling. This film tells his story and that of the gang leaders he came up against, and also learns about their descendants, revealing whether violence is still part of life in working-class Salford.(n)

programme.title: Storm Troupers: The Fight to Forecast the Weather
programme.desc: Alok Jha discovers how accurate weather forecasting came to be a vital part of military strategy, from the Great War trenches to The Second World War bombing of Berlin and D-Day.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a series of journeys through London and its environs, beginning in the Buckinghamshire market town of Amersham, where he discovers the foundations of modern-day suburbia. In Pinner, he finds out about a Victorian domestic goddess, investigates the terraced catacombs of Highgate cemetery and ends with a trip to London Zoo in Regent's Park.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: Bridging the Gap - How the Severn Bridge Was Built.
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as `the most perfect suspension bridge in the world', and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident.(n)

programme.title: Koko: The Gorilla Who Talks to People
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of the only `talking' gorilla in the world, Koko, and her lifelong relationship with animal psychologist Penny Patterson. Project Koko began as a PhD project to teach sign language to a baby gorilla, but an intense bond formed between the pair, and they have now been together for over 40 years. More than 2,000 hours of footage chart the most dramatic moments of Koko's unique life with Penny, from the battle to prevent the gorilla being taken back to the zoo in which she was born, to a clash with academic critics.(n)

programme.title: The Girl Who Talked to Dolphins
programme.desc: Documentary exploring an attempt to teach a dolphin to understand English. In the 1960s, a scientist flooded a house and invited a young woman to live there full time with the animal in the hope that the creature would be able to communicate with her. Featuring contributions from those involved in the experiment, who are speaking about events for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary following animal rights lawyer Steven Wise in an unprecedented challenge, as he and his legal team file the first lawsuits that seek to transform an animal from something with no rights, to one with legal protection. Supported by affidavits from primatologists, Steven maintains that, based on scientific evidence, cognitively complex animals such as chimpanzees, whales, dolphins and elephants have the capacity for limited personhood rights.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 201. A line of push lawn mowers, a push-up machine called the Body Jac, a kids' birthday-party franchise, a solution for kids getting carsick and a product whose inventor believes it will save children's lives are pitched. Jeff Foxworthy is an investor(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 403. A posture-correction device is demonstrated by two professional dancers; entertainment reporter Robin Leach helps pitch a line of stone-studded leather jewelry; a Vermont couple try to sell the investors on vegan, gluten-free cookies; and a business idea from a Louisiana woman who calls herself the Diaper Queen. Also: a follow-up on a San Diego man's Season 3 stand-up paddle boards(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 611. Three sisters make a pitch for their dating app; an entrepreneur claims to have a solution to a common problem for online shoppers; a former publisher shares her design for a shirt that makes people look skinny; and a pair of Wall Street brokers demonstrate a compact way to eat a bagel. Also: an update on Hamboards, which Robert invested in during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 727. Products include a motion-activated toilet light; an alternative to traditional beer; and interactive pet toys. Also: A self-proclaimed introvert pitches fashions with unusual flair; and an update is offered on the Lose 12 Inches workout program, which Daymond John invested in during Season 4(n)

programme.title: The Profit

programme.desc: Episode 204. Mark Cuban tries to monopolize the action by urging entrepreneurs not to negotiate with the other sharks if they hope to do business with him. Male-oriented candles, a wedding innovation and an eco-friendly way to listen to music on the go are pitched(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 524. A service that helps people find and hire music instructors; an idea for preventing accidental fire-sprinkler discharges; and a battery charger that's the brainchild of two friends from Salt Lake City. Also: an update on Ava the Elephant, a medicine dispenser for children invested in by Barbara during Season 1(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 703. Talent manager Troy Carter, the founder, chairman and CEO of Atom Factory, appears as a "guest shark." Included: A duo from Dallas pitch their eclectic sock of the month club subscription; an entrepreneur from Springdale, Md., has a valet and garage parking app; and parents tout the benefits of their grippy balm that keeps eyeglasses from slipping. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 721. Silicon Valley billionaire Chris Sacca returns to the panel, which also includes Mark Cuban, Daymond John, Barbara Corcoran and Kevin O'Leary. Included: An entrepreneur from Philadelphia pitches a smart plate that could help with dieting problems; and two Minneapolis women have created a sweetener that tastes just like honey, but not made by bees. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 618.
