programme.title: Diana: 7 Days That Shook the Windsors
programme.desc: Documentary following the aftermath of Princess Diana's death in 1997, when the Royal Family nearly lost its place in the hearts of the people. It features testimony from government insider Anji Hunter, director of government relations at the time, plus Diana's personal security consultant Colin Tebutt.(n)

programme.title: Diana
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following the Princess of Wales in the last two years of her life. Under constant media scrutiny, she finds a new public role for herself as a patron of humanitarian causes, while secretly conducting a passionate affair with a Pakistani heart surgeon. Starring Naomi Watts and Naveen Andrews.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: The Australian drama returns with Joan Ferguson stirring up trouble when she takes over as governor of Wentworth Correctional Centre with the intention of clamping down hard and reminding the inmates who is in charge. She decides to put an end to Franky Doyle's reign as top dog and sets about manoeuvring the situation so Bea Smith can take over, and also tells warder Will Jackson that his drink and drugs support group for the women is to be terminated. Starring Pamela Rabe, Nicole da Silva and Danielle Cormack.(n)

programme.title: Witches: A Century of Murder
programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb investigates the origins of the obsession for mass witch hunts and trials that swept the British Isles during the 17th century. Travelling to Scotland and Denmark, she challenges the accepted wisdom that King James VI of Scotland, later James I of England, was responsible for stirring up the hysteria. She also tells the story of Scotland's first mass witch trial in 1590 and the infamous Pendle witch trials towards the end of his reign.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton head for Sandhurst, Berkshire, to offer advice to Julie Frith, the owner of a four-bedroom house that has remained unsold for a year, despite two reductions in the asking price. The first thing that strikes potential buyers is the property's unfinished feel.(n)

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Cambridge art historian Paul Binski explores approaches to religious architecture, comparing Canterbury Cathedral's 12th-century stained-glass windows with those of York Minster, which were created only 100 years later, yet reflect a very different view of man's relationship with God.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: Lily finds a picture frame on the beach and goes to look for a photo for it, while Wee Rabbit is embarrassed when everyone laughs at her picture.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: The rabbit is helping Lee and Sioux look for acorns in heaps of fallen leaves, when a chimpanzee named Wookey turns up and joins in.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The postman's daughter Zoe Zebra delivers a very special letter for Peppa and George - an invitation to her birthday party.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.sub-title: I Don't Want to Play the Piano.
programme.desc: Aunty brings a piano to the castle, but Little Princess realises that learning to play it requires a lot of hard work.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: A baby bat takes a nap inside the Town Hall's bell and patrol try to rescue it without waking it up.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are asked to build the launch pad for Mei Moon's rocket, but the launch is in danger of being cancelled when Lofty makes a mistake.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mike prepares a special anniversary surprise for Helen, but a storm and a power-cut end up causing a fire.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps recover a kite that has been blown away by the wind.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive Monkey is at an animal rescue centre to help some of his four-legged friends find a home.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Zeta steals the girls' magical gem in order to enchant some cleaning supplies, which go on to cause chaos.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of Smartysaurus's Rainbow Experiment.
programme.desc: When Smartysaurus' latest experiment sees her attempt to make a rainbow, something goes wrong and Noddy needs to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder entrusts the care of Adventure Bay to Robo-Dog while he and the Pups take a well-deserved break. But Robo-Dog runs amuck fixing things.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.sub-title: Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf Swap Jobs for One Whole Day.
programme.desc: Nanny and the Wise Old Elf argue about who works the hardest, so King Thistle demands that they swap jobs for the day to settle the dispute.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Digby reads the story of Black McKracken to Sprite - and then hears a McKracken-like noise outside. Could it be that Red Rufus' arch enemy is here in Applecross?.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George plays hide-and-seek with Peppa, but is not very good at it.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: Mofy accidentally breaks Kerry's bagpipe, and she leaves Lee and Sioux with a promise that they will not tell Kerry while she goes for help.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: The little girl meets a clumsy elephant called Ellington who wants to be an acrobat.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The duo learn how to catch autumn leaves, and Alien uses magic to create a special carpet they can sit on and use to fly around the meadow.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and his guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi faces one of her toughest challenges in Bude, Cornwall, where she sets out to help Trevor Rounding, the owner of the Atlantic House Hotel, who has a reputation for hiding away from his guests. After his partner recently stepped away from the business, former engineer Trevor has been forced front of house, but it soon becomes clear to the hotel inspector and his guests that it is not his natural habitat.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Jon Bentley and Georgie Barrat head to north Wales to test a Parrot Disco fixed-wing drone against a DJI Mavi, the latter being a more traditional quadcopter. Georgie also goes behind the scenes at a stately home in Hampshire that doubles as one of the world's most advanced computer research labs. Plus, Jordan Erica Webber reports on the latest gaming releases. Presented by Craig Charles.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin and Tori confiscate Brody's bank cards until he is drug-free, Leah tells Zac that their marriage is over and Roo collapses while moving back into Summer Bay House.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Paige's trip is cut short when an unexpected incident takes place, Elly stands her ground when confronted by Finn, and Aaron's hopes at a romance with David are revived.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part one of two. The agents investigate when two men are killed at a gun shop, but soon discover one of their colleagues could be at risk. Callen learns the Chameleon - a criminal out for revenge - is involved, and races to track him down. However, when he comes face to face with the fugitive, he is tricked into answering a phone wired to a car bomb.(n)

programme.title: Saved from Sorrow: Mysterious Grace
programme.desc: Premiere. A retired police officer, despondent over the deaths of his family, meets a mysterious woman who through her personal stories gives him a reason to rethink what is most important to him. Drama, starring Joey Lawrence, Robin Riker, Muse Watson and Catalina Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Paige's trip is cut short when an unexpected incident takes place, Elly stands her ground when confronted by Finn, and Aaron's hopes at a romance with David are revived.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin and Tori confiscate Brody's bank cards until he is drug-free, Leah tells Zac that their marriage is over and Roo collapses while moving back into Summer Bay House.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.sub-title: Party Election Broadcast: The Green Party.
programme.desc: A party election broadcast on behalf of the Green Party ahead of the general election.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dan Brigginshaw tracks down a driver who has given him the slip on the side roads of Spalding, while Suzie Ranyard comes to the rescue of a motorist with a rather large passenger. Jim Woolerton utilises some of the unit's most advanced kit to catch out a disqualified driver and officers are called out when a dead body is spotted in one of Lincolnshire's many waterways.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: New series. Dan Jones, Suzannah Lipscomb and Rob Bell take a fresh look at the Great Fire of London in 1666 by walking the actual route the fire took across the city, hour-by-hour and street-by-street, hoping to uncover what really happened during Britain's worst inferno. In this first edition, the three presenters investigate how the fire started, heading to Pudding Lane, site of the bakery where the blaze broke out. Dan and historian Dorian Gerhold then place a temporary `blue plaque' on the very spot where the fire began.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Officers chase £4,500 in court fees in North Wales after a property deal turned sour, and in Birmingham the agents try to collect over £3,500 from a single mum who defaulted on loan repayments. Elsewhere in Worcestershire, the enforcement agents try to recover more than £10,000 from a shop-keeper for fraudulently keeping a deposit during a property sale.(n)

programme.title: The Butcher Surgeon: Why Wasn't He Stopped
programme.desc: Documentary profiling former breast surgeon Ian Paterson, who was recently convicted of intentionally wounding patients by performing needless operations for more than a decade. Paterson was found guilty on 17 counts, and this programme examines how was he able to continue for so long, asking whether his employers might have ignored or failed to act on a series of warnings stretching back to 2003. Some of Paterson's victims are also interviewed, along with health service whistleblowers.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Susan and Gary bought an East End flat to let out and were approached by a letting agent who promised hassle-free guaranteed rent. But before they knew it, he had broken in and changed the locks. Now they are fighting to get the property back. Meanwhile, landlord Paul discovers that his seriously ill father's long-standing tenant owes a staggering £20k in rent for living in her Notting Hill home.(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: After being discharged from the Army, Brian Flanagan (Tom Cruise) moves back to Queens and takes a job in a bar run by Doug Coughlin (Bryan Brown), who teaches Brian the fine art of bartending. Brian quickly becomes a patron favorite with his flashy drink-mixing style. Brian adopts his mentor's cynical philosophy on life and goes for the money. He leaves his artist girlfriend Jordan Mooney (Elisabeth Shue) for Bonnie (Lisa Banes), a wealthy, high-powered executive. Brian soon must chose between the two, as he evaluates his options. Scriptwriter Heywood Gould displayed his sense of humor when assigning the character name "Mr. Mooney" to Lucille Ball's real-life son-in-law, actor Laurence Luckenbill. Television fans of The Lucy Show will recall Mr. Mooney, played by Gale Gordon, as Lucy's fussy financial boss. The film is more memorable for the 17-song soundtrack and plays like a series of MTV videos. Cocktail was a big draw at the box office in 1988(n)

programme.title: O
programme.desc: A modernized retelling of William Shakespeare's +Othello, O changes its setting to an elite private school in the American South. Odin (Mekhi Phifer) is the only black student at Palmetto Grove and also the star basketball player, with hopes of reaching the NBA. A popular student, he is dating Desi Brable (Julia Stiles), the daughter of the school's dean (John Heard), and they are deeply devoted to each other despite their different backgrounds. His best friend Hugo (Josh Hartnett) is a starter on the basketball team, and the son of the hard-driving coach Duke Goulding (Martin Sheen), who considers Odin as much his son as Hugo. Hugo is jealous of Odin's widespread popularity, so he hatches a scheme to ruin Odin's reputation with the help of Roger (Elden Henson), his rich roommate who will do anything to be popular and get Desi's attention. Through carefully planned revenge, he begins to make Odin believe that Desi is carrying out an affair with teammate Michael (Andrew Keegan). As Odin begins to receive merely coincidental signs to prove it, he begins to slowly lose his grounding and turns to Hugo for help, not knowing that he is being set up. As the basketball season comes to a close, Odin's jealousy begins to consume him, resulting in the loss of everything he cares about the most. O was sometime actor Tim Blake Nelson's directorial follow-up to his well-received debut Eye of God(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: The hands-down best of the Bruce Lee kung fu vehicles, Enter the Dragon finds Lee infiltrating the island stronghold of suspected drug kingpin Shih Kien. Ostensibly on the island to enter a martial arts contest, Lee finds himself matched against Kien's fiercest henchman, Bob Wall. He kills Wall, but is unable to escape the many booby traps festooning the island. The final battle royale pits Lee against Kien, and Lee's former army buddy John Saxon against the formidable Yang Tse. There's more to the plot than that, of course, but action fans of 1973 weren't interested in the intrigues--they wanted to "cut to the chase" and revel in Bruce Lee's split-second chopsocky technique. Enter the Dragon is so good that it even survives the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker parody in Kentucky Fried Movie (1977)(n)

programme.title: Say Anything...
programme.desc: A film about the attempts of an average student, John Cusack, to win the heart of the beautiful Ione Skye before she goes off to college(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Director Clint Eastwood draws on his experience to put together a western with winning components: the bad guys are corporate jerks out for a profit at the expense of Mother Nature, the good guys are poor but independent gold miners threatened by the corporation, the hero Preacher (Eastwood) is there to set things right, and he is beyond any of that romance stuff. Preacher's shady past is implied when he first comes into town and keeps his anonymity intact. He is sheltered by an unmarried duo, Hull and Sarah (Michael Moriarty and Carrie Snodgress), and soon pays them back by saving Hull from a few murderous thugs. Caught in the middle of the growing conflict, Preacher rallies the miners into a combative group and then goes on to final showdown in true "high noon" style(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: Director Scott Derrickson's remake of the 1951 sci-fi classic replaces the original's theme of fear of impending nuclear war with current concerns for environmental catastrophe. Keanu Reeves stars as Klaatu, an alien sent by a confederation of extraterrestrial beings to warn the inhabitants of Earth that the biosphere is on the verge of collapse. Predictably, as soon as he emerges from his spaceship a trigger-happy soldier ignores his instructions and takes a shot at the visitor. The wounded Klaatu asks for access to the United Nations to deliver his message, but the Secretary of Defence, Regina Jackson, instead orders that he should be taken away for further investigations. Klaatu becomes increasingly convinced that Earth can only survive if mankind is eradicated..(n)

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: A mother is caught in a race against time to save her child in this taut suspense thriller. Dr. Will Jennings (Stuart Townsend) and his wife, Karen (Charlize Theron), find their world has been turned upside down when they're taken hostage and held in different cities while their young daughter is kidnapped by the same band of ruthless criminals. Joe Hickey (Kevin Bacon) has hatched a seemingly foolproof plan with his wife, Cheryl (Courtney Love), and cousin, Marvin (Pruitt Taylor Vince): while Dr. Jennings and Mrs. Jennings are under guard and unable to contact the police, Hickey will demand a massive ransom for the return of their daughter. If the payment is not arranged in 24 hours, the girl will be killed. Will and Karen realize it's imperative that they find their daughter as soon as possible, as she suffers from a medical condition that could claim her life if she doesn't receive her medication within a day, but as Karen plots a way to get away from Joe and rescue her little girl, she discovers money isn't the only reason Joe has chosen the Jenningses as his victims. Trapped was based on the novel 24 Hours by Greg Iles; 24 Hours was also announced as the film's title before it was changed to avoid being confused with the popular television series 24(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: In this sequel to Pitch Perfect, the collegiate a cappella group called the Barden Bellas enter into an international competition, but they are told it will be impossible to win because they are from the U.S. The girls refuse to give up and vow to be the first Americans to take home the top prize. Directed by Elizabeth Banks, the film stars Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson, and Hailee Steinfeld(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Actor Edward Norton debuts as a director with this comedy-drama about love, friendship, and faith. Priest Brian Finn (Norton) and rabbi Jacob Schram (Ben Stiller) have known each other since childhood. When Anna Reilly (Jenna Elfman), whom they both knew as children, returns to New York, both men find themselves infatuated with her, sparking both rivalry and personal dilemmas: Brian has taken a vow of celibacy, and Jacob is allowed to marry only within his faith. Award-winning director Milos Forman appears in the supporting cast, alongside Anne Bancroft, Ron Rifkin, and Eli Wallach; the screenplay marks the debut of writer Stuart Blumberg, whom Norton met when they were both undergraduates at Yale(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Ben Stiller directs and stars in this satire on the fashion industry as the eponymous Zoolander, an air-head male model who's eclipsed by the equally vacuous Hansel. To make matters worse, fashion designer Mugatu plans to turn Zoolander into an international assassin(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer and her writer husband take a cross-country journey to a small coastal town where they bond with its quirky but wise inhabitants(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this survival tale based on a true story, a 19th century frontiersman is left for dead after being attacked by his comrades, only to survive and claim his revenge(n)

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: Based on the popular series of books by Darren Shan, Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant tells the story of a small-town teen who inadvertently shatters a 200-year-old truce between warring factions of vampires. Sixteen-year-old Darren (Chris Massoglia) is your typical adolescent; he spends most of his time with his best friend, Steve (Josh Hutcherson), earns decent grades, and generally manages to stay out of trouble. But trouble finds Darren when he and Steve make the acquaintance of a vampire named Larten Crepsley (John C. Reilly) while attending a traveling freak show at a local theater. Transformed into a bloodsucker by Crepsley, Darren joins the Cirque Du Freak and quickly ingratiates himself with the unusual cast of characters who populate it, including Madame Truska the Bearded Lady (Salma Hayek) and the traveling sideshow's towering barker (Ken Watanabe). As Darren works to master his newfound powers as a budding member of the supernatural underworld, he becomes a valued pawn between the vampires and their deadlier rivals, the Vampaneze. With tensions between the two sects intensifying, Darren must figure out a means of keeping the coming war from destroying his last vestige of humanity. Patrick Fugit, Orlando Jones, Willem Dafoe, and Jane Krakowski co-star(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: Horror remake. A young family move to a big house in the New York suburbs which they bought at a bargain price. But when they start to be terrorised by supernatural forces, they discover the house was the scene of a recent mass killing and was also the home of an 18th-century satanist(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Mistaken for terrorists, stoners Harold and Kumar are thrown into maximum security prison(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Fast-paced action comedy in which a dowdy romantic-adventure writer is hurled into a real-life adventure in the Colombian jungle in order to save her sister, who will be killed if a treasure map is not delivered to her captors. She is helped out by a brash mercenary, and together they search for the priceless gem located in the map. A non-stop mix of thrills, laughter and romance with energetic performances all round(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: This biographical drama explores the genius and shortcomings of computing guru Steve Jobs in backstage vignettes spanning 14 years, as he and his closest advisers prepare for three different public presentations of era-defining technologies(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Biopic of controversial comedian Andy Kaufman, starring Jim Carrey. Star of Taxi and Saturday Night Live, Kaufman was a troubled individual for whom the boundaries of reality and stage performance were often blurred. Frequently misunderstood, even by those closest to him, he remained a strictly maverick entertainer until his untimely death from lung cancer in 1984(n)

programme.title: MI-5
programme.desc: In this thrilling spy film, Will Holloway, a former MI-5 agent, is forced to partner with Harry Pearce, the man decommissioned him, to apprehend a terrorist who escaped during routine prisoner transport and prevent an attack on the city of London. Based on a British televison series "Spooks."(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: An artist and an ex-CIA agent work together to take down terrorists in France(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: This satirical comedy starring Sandra Bullock as a political consultant gives viewers an inside look at the high-stakes, win-at-all-costs world of politics. Bullock stars as "Calamity" Jane Bodine, who is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival Pat Candy (Billy Bob Thornton), who is working on the opponent's campaign and is also looking for every opportunity to antagonize Jane. The film is loosely based on the 2005 documentary of the same name by Rachel Boynton. Directed by David Gordon Green (Pineapple Express, George Washington). Produced by Oscar-winners George Clooney and Grant Heslov(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: Michael Clayton handles all of the dirty work for a major New York law firm, arranging top-flight legal services and skirting through loopholes for ethically questionable clients. But when a fellow fixer decides to turn on the very firm they were hired to clean up for, Clayton finds himself at the centre of a conspiratorial maelstrom(n)

programme.title: Blood and Wine
programme.desc: Modern-day film noir, set in Miami, about a wine merchant and a jewel thief who plan the theft of a one million dollar diamond necklace. But things go awry when the wine merchant's wife and son decide to leave him - unwittingly taking the stolen necklace with them(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three bright young students venture deep into the Nevada desert in search of a notorious hacker, and discover they have been drawn into an enigmatic plot with terrifying repercussions in this mind-bending sci-fi thriller. Intrigued by reports that a mysterious hacker named Nomad has breached MIT's advanced security system and exposed its flaws, freshmen Nic (Brenton Thwaites) and Jonah (Beau Knapp) hop in the car with Nick's girlfriend Hailey (Olivia Cooke), and attempt to track down the elusive computer genius. Eventually, the trail of clues leads the three students deep into the Nevada desert. There, they finally come face-to-face with Nomad just before everything goes black. Later, regaining consciousness in a high-security government facility, a confused Nic quickly finds that the worst is yet to come. Laurence Fishburne co-stars(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: After being discharged from the Army, Brian Flanagan (Tom Cruise) moves back to Queens and takes a job in a bar run by Doug Coughlin (Bryan Brown), who teaches Brian the fine art of bartending. Brian quickly becomes a patron favorite with his flashy drink-mixing style. Brian adopts his mentor's cynical philosophy on life and goes for the money. programme.title: Say Anything...
programme.desc: A film about the attempts of an average student, John Cusack, to win the heart of the beautiful Ione Skye before she goes off to college(n)

programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

Keanu Reeves stars as Klaatu, an alien sent by a confederation of extraterrestrial beings to warn the inhabitants of Earth that the biosphere is on the verge of collapse. Predictably, as soon as he emerges from his spaceship a trigger-happy soldier ignores his instructions and takes a shot at the visitor. The wounded Klaatu asks for access to the United Nations to deliver his message, but the Secretary of Defence, Regina Jackson, instead orders that he should be taken away for further investigations. Klaatu becomes increasingly convinced that Earth can only survive if mankind is eradicated..(n)

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: A mother is caught in a race against time to save her child in this taut suspense thriller. Dr. Will Jennings (Stuart Townsend) and his wife, Karen (Charlize Theron), find their world has been turned upside down when they're taken hostage and held in different cities while their young daughter is kidnapped by the same band of ruthless criminals. Joe Hickey (Kevin Bacon) has hatched a seemingly foolproof plan with his wife, Cheryl (Courtney Love), and cousin, Marvin (Pruitt Taylor Vince): while Dr. Jennings and Mrs. Jennings are under guard and unable to contact the police, Hickey will demand a massive ransom for the return of their daughter. If the payment is not arranged in 24 hours, the girl will be killed. Will and Karen realize it's imperative that they find their daughter as soon as possible, as she suffers from a medical condition that could claim her life if she doesn't receive her medication within a day, but as Karen plots a way to get away from Joe and rescue her little girl, she discovers money isn't the only reason Joe has chosen the Jenningses as his victims. Trapped was based on the novel 24 Hours by Greg Iles; 24 Hours was also announced as the film's title before it was changed to avoid being confused with the popular television series 24(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: In this sequel to Pitch Perfect, the collegiate a cappella group called the Barden Bellas enter into an international competition, but they are told it will be impossible to win because they are from the U.S. The girls refuse to give up and vow to be the first Americans to take home the top prize. Directed by Elizabeth Banks, the film stars Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson, and Hailee Steinfeld(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Actor Edward Norton debuts as a director with this comedy-drama about love, friendship, and faith. Priest Brian Finn (Norton) and rabbi Jacob Schram (Ben Stiller) have known each other since childhood. When Anna Reilly (Jenna Elfman), whom they both knew as children, returns to New York, both men find themselves infatuated with her, sparking both rivalry and personal dilemmas: Brian has taken a vow of celibacy, and Jacob is allowed to marry only within his faith. Award-winning director Milos Forman appears in the supporting cast, alongside Anne Bancroft, Ron Rifkin, and Eli Wallach; the screenplay marks the debut of writer Stuart Blumberg, whom Norton met when they were both undergraduates at Yale(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Ben Stiller directs and stars in this satire on the fashion industry as the eponymous Zoolander, an air-head male model who's eclipsed by the equally vacuous Hansel. To make matters worse, fashion designer Mugatu plans to turn Zoolander into an international assassin(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: SNL alumni Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this Universal Studios comedy about two daffy adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, who decide to throw one last wild party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going disastrously awry. Written by Paula Pell and directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer and her writer husband take a cross-country journey to a small coastal town where they bond with its quirky but wise inhabitants(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this survival tale based on a true story, a 19th century frontiersman is left for dead after being attacked by his comrades, only to survive and claim his revenge(n)

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: Based on the popular series of books by Darren Shan, Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant tells the story of a small-town teen who inadvertently shatters a 200-year-old truce between warring factions of vampires. Sixteen-year-old Darren (Chris Massoglia) is your typical adolescent; he spends most of his time with his best friend, Steve (Josh Hutcherson), earns decent grades, and generally manages to stay out of trouble. But trouble finds Darren when he and Steve make the acquaintance of a vampire named Larten Crepsley (John C. Reilly) while attending a traveling freak show at a local theater. Transformed into a bloodsucker by Crepsley, Darren joins the Cirque Du Freak and quickly ingratiates himself with the unusual cast of characters who populate it, including Madame Truska the Bearded Lady (Salma Hayek) and the traveling sideshow's towering barker (Ken Watanabe). As Darren works to master his newfound powers as a budding member of the supernatural underworld, he becomes a valued pawn between the vampires and their deadlier rivals, the Vampaneze. With tensions between the two sects intensifying, Darren must figure out a means of keeping the coming war from destroying his last vestige of humanity. Patrick Fugit, Orlando Jones, Willem Dafoe, and Jane Krakowski co-star(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: Horror remake. A young family move to a big house in the New York suburbs which they bought at a bargain price. But when they start to be terrorised by supernatural forces, they discover the house was the scene of a recent mass killing and was also the home of an 18th-century satanist(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Mistaken for terrorists, stoners Harold and Kumar are thrown into maximum security prison(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Fast-paced action comedy in which a dowdy romantic-adventure writer is hurled into a real-life adventure in the Colombian jungle in order to save her sister, who will be killed if a treasure map is not delivered to her captors. She is helped out by a brash mercenary, and together they search for the priceless gem located in the map. A non-stop mix of thrills, laughter and romance with energetic performances all round(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: This biographical drama explores the genius and shortcomings of computing guru Steve Jobs in backstage vignettes spanning 14 years, as he and his closest advisers prepare for three different public presentations of era-defining technologies(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Biopic of controversial comedian Andy Kaufman, starring Jim Carrey. Star of Taxi and Saturday Night Live, Kaufman was a troubled individual for whom the boundaries of reality and stage performance were often blurred. Frequently misunderstood, even by those closest to him, he remained a strictly maverick entertainer until his untimely death from lung cancer in 1984(n)

programme.title: MI-5
programme.desc: In this thrilling spy film, Will Holloway, a former MI-5 agent, is forced to partner with Harry Pearce, the man decommissioned him, to apprehend a terrorist who escaped during routine prisoner transport and prevent an attack on the city of London. Based on a British televison series "Spooks."(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: An artist and an ex-CIA agent work together to take down terrorists in France(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: This satirical comedy starring Sandra Bullock as a political consultant gives viewers an inside look at the high-stakes, win-at-all-costs world of politics. Bullock stars as "Calamity" Jane Bodine, who is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival Pat Candy (Billy Bob Thornton), who is working on the opponent's campaign and is also looking for every opportunity to antagonize Jane. The film is loosely based on the 2005 documentary of the same name by Rachel Boynton. Directed by David Gordon Green (Pineapple Express, George Washington). Produced by Oscar-winners George Clooney and Grant Heslov(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: Michael Clayton handles all of the dirty work for a major New York law firm, arranging top-flight legal services and skirting through loopholes for ethically questionable clients. But when a fellow fixer decides to turn on the very firm they were hired to clean up for, Clayton finds himself at the centre of a conspiratorial maelstrom(n)

programme.desc: In the fading days of the pharaohs, Heracleion was the gateway to Egypt and a port beyond compare, but around 1,200 years ago a mysterious subsidence led to it being consumed by the Mediterranean. programme.title: Nasa's Ten Greatest Achievements
programme.desc: The first of two programmes exploring some of the most monumental accomplishments made by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.(n)

programme.title: Cosmonauts: The Space Race
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the influence Soviet cosmonauts had on the development of space projects in the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Part one of two. Recent telescope images are combined with CGI technology to illustrate the sights and sounds of alien worlds. Powerful modern telescopes and unmanned space missions have revealed a wide range of dynamic environments, prompting scientists to expand their ideas about the possibility that life may be present elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: The Thirteen Factors That Saved Apollo 13
programme.desc: The story of the near-disastrous 1970 moon mission when a malfunction saw the leak of precious oxygen and the aircraft's crew of three astronauts facing a life-and-death crisis. This first of two programmes details the incidents that eventually secured the safety of those on board. Featuring Nasa footage and interviews with space scientists.(n)

programme.title: Nasa's Ten Greatest Achievements
programme.desc: The first of two programmes exploring some of the most monumental accomplishments made by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.(n)

programme.title: Last Steps: The Apollo 17 Experience
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about the last space mission to land on the moon, making use of Nasa footage, mission audio and interviews with the astronauts to chronicle the trip.(n)

programme.title: The Sky Is Not the Limit
programme.desc: Colonel Chris Hadfield, the first Canadian to walk in space, discusses what it takes to become an astronaut. The one-time commander of the International Space Station shares an insight into the training, skills and preparation essential to running the orbital facility, and offers a view of Earth from the perspective of someone who has seen it from 370km above the surface.(n)

programme.title: Aloha
programme.desc: A disgraced military defense contractor (Bradley Cooper) is rehired by an old boss to oversee the launch of a weapons satellite in Hawaii. Upon his arrival he reconnects with an old love (Rachel McAdams) but finds himself becoming increasingly attracted to an Air Force pilot (Emma Stone) assigned to watch over him(n)

programme.title: Mallrats
programme.desc: Bawdy U.S. comedy film about two comic-obsessed students who are dumped by their respective girlfriends and try to come to terms with their romantic loss at the local shopping mall(n)

programme.title: Pawn
programme.desc: A cop stumbles into a robbery at a 24-hour diner, resulting in an explosive hostage situation in this twisting tale of crime and betrayal starring Forest Whitaker, Michael Chiklis, Common and Ray Liotta(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo
programme.desc: After an accident involving his pimp and an overly-aggressive dolphin, reluctant escort Deuce heads to Amsterdam. There he finds himself in danger from a mysterious gigolo killer. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Aloha
programme.desc: A disgraced military defense contractor (Bradley Cooper) is rehired by an old boss to oversee the launch of a weapons satellite in Hawaii. Upon his arrival he reconnects with an old love (Rachel McAdams) but finds himself becoming increasingly attracted to an Air Force pilot (Emma Stone) assigned to watch over him(n)

programme.title: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: Michael Douglas stars as a loving husband and father who has a fling with Glenn Close, only to find that when he tries to distance himself from her, he's caught in the web of a manipulative and increasingly violent woman. Adrian Lyne's Oscar-winning drama isn't just a thriller but also explores fidelity, sexual mores and the role of career women in the 80s (as well as giving the world the phrase 'bunny-boiler')(n)

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: Remake of the Steve McQueen caper film with Pierce Brosnan as a billionaire art fancier who orchestrates the theft of a priceless masterpiece(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn's Finest
programme.desc: In 'Brooklyn's Finest', we're taken on a dark ride through the streets of Brooklyn, following three New York Police officers as they wrestle with temptation while attempting to uphold the law and deal with the pressures of the job. Eddie (Richard Gere) is a bitter and disillusioned veteran cop who's a week away from retirement. Tango (Don Cheadle) is an undercover narcotics cop who tries desperately to leave the streets and earn a promotion to a desk job. Much like Eddie, he's lost sight of his priorities and his loyalties seem to lie more with notorious inner-city drug dealer Caz (Wesley Snipes) than with the boys in blue. At the same time, narcotics detective Sal is a family man in despair and needs to raise money to buy a better house for his family. In seven days, the lives of all three officers will converge at one crime scene(n)

programme.title: Aloha
programme.desc: A disgraced military defense contractor (Bradley Cooper) is rehired by an old boss to oversee the launch of a weapons satellite in Hawaii. Upon his arrival he reconnects with an old love (Rachel McAdams) but finds himself becoming increasingly attracted to an Air Force pilot (Emma Stone) assigned to watch over him(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan named Ella is treated cruelly by her stepmother and stepsisters, who force her to do menial chores. However, her life changes forever when she meets a prince(n)

programme.title: Wild Hogs
programme.desc: Frustrated with their lives, four middle-aged men decide to hit the open road and embark on a motorcycle road trip to California. Trouble strikes when they run into the Del Fuegos, a fierce biker gang, and a series of unfortunate incidents leave the Wild Hogs on the run from the Del Fuegos in New Mexico. Do they have what it takes to stand up to their pursuers? Starring Tim Allen, John Travolta, Martin Lawrence, William H Macy, Ray Liotta, Marisa Tomei(n)

programme.title: In & Out
programme.desc: Frank Oz's stylish comedy-satire stars Kevin Kline as Howard Brackett, a popular small-town high school teacher who is engaged to his fellow teacher Emily. Then ex-pupil turned film star Cameron Drake mentions him in his Oscar-acceptance speech, inadvertently outing him as gay. Everyone, including Howard, is shocked but, as well as coping with the town's reactions, he must deal with his own feelings. With Debbie Reynolds, Bob Newhart and Tom Selleck. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland
programme.desc: The walls of time and space break down in this rollicking sci-fi adventure, in which an ambitious teen discovers a pin that transports her to a futuristic world. She then teams up with a jaded genius, and they embark on a mission to save the Earth(n)

programme.title: Bull Durham
programme.desc: A minor-league catcher and a baseball groupie team to help a talented young pitcher make it to the big leagues, and fall in love in the process(n)

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: Remake of the Steve McQueen caper film with Pierce Brosnan as a billionaire art fancier who orchestrates the theft of a priceless masterpiece(n)

programme.title: Hope Floats
programme.desc: A woman who comes back to her home town in Smithville, Texas, with her daughter after a very sloppy and painful divorce has to deal with the people in her town(n)

programme.title: 'Neath Arizona Skies
programme.desc: Western with John Wayne as the guardian of a little girl that needs to find her missing father, so she can finally have her late mother's money. The only problem is that a dangerous gang has their eyes on the money as well(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan named Ella is treated cruelly by her stepmother and stepsisters, who force her to do menial chores. However, her life changes forever when she meets a prince(n)

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: When two children find a mysterious old board game and start to play it, they release a mysterious man called Alan, who's closely followed by a horde of stampedimg animals! It seeems he and a friend discovered the game 25 years earlier, and he became trapped in it. Can the two kids tame the madcap menagerie and help Alan to escape from his supernatural prison? Great computer animated effects and some excellent perfromances make this a truly magical film that's fun for all the family(n)

programme.title: Bucky Larson: Born to Be a Star
programme.desc: Adam Sandler co-writes and produces this Columbia Pictures comedy starring Nick Swardson as Bucky Larson, a nerd from nowhere who heads out West to become a porn star after finding out his parents were ones themselves. Upon arriving in Hollywood, a waitress (Christina Ricci) with self-esteem issues gets him situated in the slightly less seedy part of town. Meanwhile, Bucky connects with a friend of his parents, Miles Deep (Don Johnson), who pities the backwards man-child and gives him a shot in the world of porn - only to discover that he's severely lacking in both experience and manliness. Through sheer luck, the footage of Bucky becomes a viral hit on the internet and he is propelled to the top of the adult film business, irking the current king of porn actors, Dick Shadow (Stephen Dorff), who'll do anything to not be in the shadow of the small time fool. The Hot Chick's Tom Brady handled directing duties(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: A retired Special Forces colonel storms the South American stronghold of terrorists who have kidnapped his daughter to blackmail him into deposing a Latin dictator(n)

programme.title: Pumpkinhead II: Blood Wings
programme.desc: A New York City policeman returns with his family to the small, quiet town of his childhood to escape big city life. His rebellious teenage daughter, however, ends up with the wrong crowd and unknowingly conjures up the remains of Pumpkinhead(n)

programme.title: The Peacemaker
programme.desc: A pair of mismatched government operatives set out to recover stolen nuclear warheads from international terrorists. When missiles being transported on a Russian train are supposedly destroyed, a brash army specialist is teamed with an ambitious female executive. They soon learn a grudging respect as the hunt for the weapons takes them across Europe and culminates in a tense Manhattan showdown(n)

programme.title: Highlander: Endgame
programme.desc: In this fantasy adventure tale, Connor MacLeod (Christopher Lambert) and his kinsman Duncan (Adrian Paul) are "Immortals," members of a secret clan who can be killed only through decapitation. Connor and Duncan find themselves thrown into a tournament where Immortals both good and evil battle one another in a bid to become the last of their kind. Highlander: Endgame was the fourth feature film in the Highlander franchise, but its narrative draws from the storyline of the Highlander television series and ignores the events of the second and third films(n)

programme.title: Grindhouse
programme.desc: In a throwback to 1970s exploitation films and drive-in double features, directors Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez serve up a chilling two-fer with "Death Proof" and "Planet Terror." The first is about a killer car; the second's a zombie flick. In the opener, Kurt Russell plays a stuntman wreaking havoc with his wheels of death. Then, survivors of a bio-weapon mishap battle an army of killer zombies. Rose McGowan has roles in both. Tarantino and Rodriguez also scripted their films(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: This program salutes the legendary filmmaker who, during World War II, ran the Field Photographic Branch, a unit that shot a raft of documentaries that captured "the scope and sprawl of World War II." Kris Kristofferson is the narrator. Included are comments by Hollywood directors Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich; and critics Leonard Maltin, Andrew Sarris and Richard Schickel(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: A wealthy businessman is apparently killed in an earthquake, but Adrian is sure that he was murdered by his wife, and sets out to investigate. Unfortunately, it is not long before the trauma of an aftershock deprives him of the power of speech.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A pupil at a school for troubled youngsters is found beaten to death in a forest. A hand-drawn map discovered in a dormitory leads Kimball and Wayne to a run-down shack where they find a volatile man who has been harassed by a secretive gang of children hurling paint at his property, shouting abuse and breaking his windows. Suspecting the group could be behind the boy's death, Patrick sets up an elaborate sting involving a campfire, a ghost story and a willing volunteer. Simon Baker stars.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A 19-year-old girl is dumped in California after being stabbed to death, with her twin sister still missing and the crime bearing the hallmarks of Red John. A love letter leads the team to a blind woman who is able to provide a rough description of the killer using her other senses, prompting Patrick to put his life on the line in a bid to catch the man who murdered his own family. Dexter's Geoff Pierson guest stars, with Simon Baker, Robin Tunney and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The grifters take on a pharmaceutical company CEO who plans to distribute a deadly drug for sizable profits. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team aims to take down a corrupt record industry executive by infiltrating the world of country and western music. However, their undercover efforts result in Eliot becoming a genuine star. Guest starring John Schneider.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A man who died after being knocked down by a van is revealed to be a professional hitman responsible for at least six contract killings - and his next target was to be a navy lieutenant commander. Meanwhile, Abby is delighted at being a match for a teenager who needs a kidney transplant, but she is informed that someone else with very similar DNA has also been identified as suitable. Has she found a relative she never knew about? Guest starring Brett Tucker (Neighbours).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a coastguard officer on board an abandoned cargo ship draws the team's attention to a family of Lebanese refugees hoping to find a new home in America. Meanwhile, Tony and McGee try to find the perfect woman for Gibbs. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane employs dubious tactics to catch the killer of a woman who was accused of stealing $1million from her employer. Setting up camp in an empty house near the victim's home, he pins a mysterious note to the door and settles back to wait, optimistic the killer will fall for the bait. Elsewhere, a messy result in another case leads CBI boss Virgil Minelli to take Lisbon off the Red John investigation. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the team are called to Sacramento, where the body of an aide to state senator Melinda Batson has been found. They arrest her stepbrother on suspicion of murder, but Jane believes political blackmail could have been the motive behind the killing, and begins his own investigation into the case. Crime drama, guest starring Paul Michael Glaser (Starsky and Hutch), with Simon Baker, Robin Tunney and Fay Masterson.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Nathan and the team target a greedy debt collector stealing funds from innocent taxpayers. However, the job becomes much more complicated when they discover their mark is also a domestic terrorist funding an armed militia. Crime drama, guest starring Clancy Brown.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Nathan and the team tackle a crooked car dealer, and decide they must play the villain at his own game to bring him down. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The body of a Navy lieutenant is found on the side of a remote road and toxicology tests reveal he died of overhydration. When another man is found dead nearby, the NCIS team begins to suspect a serial killer is on the loose. Meanwhile, Ducky introduces Gibbs to his new girlfriend. Crime drama, guest starring Cheryl Ladd.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Homeland Security employee Victor Sterling mysteriously disappears and his car is found at a drive-through restaurant that becomes the scene of a double murder. To complicate matters further, the missing man's outspoken spouse happens to be the ex-wife of both Gibbs and Fornell. American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, Joe Spano, Tom Gallop and Melinda McGraw.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Torres brings out old case notes and contacts when a US Marine's murder is linked to a dirt-bike gang, one that he joined as part of an undercover sting operation.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull aims to prove temporary insanity at a murder trial for his client, Troy Dickerson (Brendan Dooling), a young man he believes was brainwashed by a cult-like spiritual learning center to kill his father. Also, Danny and Chunk go undercover at the learning center to find the perpetrator responsible for their client's reprogramming, on Bull, Tuesday, May 2 at 9/8c. Only CBS.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and his friends fight to save their favourite booth in the Drunken Clam after it is claimed by another group of men. Meanwhile, Brian passes on herpes to Stewie. Adult animation, featuring the guest voice of Bryan Cranston (Breaking Bad).(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: The Most Interesting Man in the World.
programme.desc: Peter takes Stewie to the park for some father-son bonding, but ends up bringing home someone else's baby. After Lois chastises him for being so stupid, he goes to Chicago on a business trip and returns an intelligent, classy person.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan forgets his wedding anniversary and in desperation arranges to have 20 hours erased from Francine's memory at the CIA headquarters. However, the procedure goes awry and the hours are turned into years - so she reverts to her wild-child days and moves into her old apartment with Hayley.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The family thinks Roger has died and throws him out with the rubbish, but he wakes up at the dump and tries to make his way home. Unfortunately he is involved in a case of mistaken identity en route and ends up being taken on a pensioners' tour of the White House.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris gets teased at school for his budget-brand trainers, and asks for money to help bring his image up to scratch - but is turned down. He attempts to steal from his parents, but is forced into a blackmail pact when Meg confronts him and threatens to report his thieving antics. Meanwhile, Stewie and Brian become obsessed with singer Anne Murray.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois is forced to find a job when the family's domestic finances are stretched. She is `discovered' by a voiceover talent agent who runs an adult-only phone line and pays his employees generously for services rendered. As she settles into her new role, she gets a surprise call. Meanwhile, Peter acquires a pet falcon.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A broke Hayley gets an office job and falls for a cute colleague, prompting her to consider embarking on an affair while on a work retreat to Belize. Meanwhile, Stan chauffeurs Steve and Francine to a mother-son dance, but things turn ugly when he refuses to let them dance together.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan joins the world of old Hollywood while on vacation in Los Angeles, California, while Roger kennel trains Steve and Hayley.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris learns he is the heir to his grandfather Carter's fortune, but he refuses to take the money - leaving Peter to resort to desperate measures to keep the wealth in the family. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter takes up smoking, and is quickly approached by an advertising executive who wants him to be the face of a new campaign - for an anti-smoking group. Meanwhile, Stewie helps Chris battle some school bullies.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan feels his manhood is threatened when Francine becomes an estate agent and starts earning more than he does. Steve sets up a fighting arena in one of his mother's empty properties, enlisting homeless people to take part in no-holds-barred bouts, but his father muscles in on the money-making scheme.(n)

Drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.desc: Jane and Lisbon investigate the death of a biker gang's lawyer, who they suspect was murdered because he knew too many of the members' secrets. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.desc: The team targets a criminal who has been blackmailing businessmen into committing crimes, but Nate receives a surprise when he discovers his father is responsible.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. programme.title: Sucker Punch
programme.desc: The story of Alice in Wonderland receives a hyper-violent makeover in Watchmen and 300 director Zack Snyder's fantastical tale of a young psychiatric patient who escapes into a vivid world of fantasy after being committed to a mental hospital by her abusive stepfather. Set in the 1950s, Sucker Punch takes viewers on an incredible journey into the mind of Babydoll (Emily Browning), who finds herself at the mercy of her malevolent stepfather after her mother passes away. With no remaining family and no friends to turn to, her stepfather has her committed to a bleak mental hospital, where she is scheduled to receive a lobotomy in five days. As the procedure draws near, Babydoll creates a phantasmagorical alternate reality in which she must seek out five items in order to secure her freedom. Should she fail, her mind isn't the only thing she stands to lose. Abbie Cornish, Vanessa Hudgens, Carla Gugino, and Jon Hamm co-star in a film co-written by Snyder and Steve Shibuya(n)

programme.title: The Recruit
programme.desc: A highly intelligent computer hacker is persuaded to join the CIA by a shady agent, who lets him think there is a link between the agency and his father's death. He proves he has a natural-born talent for espionage work, but when he is given a top-secret assignment to root out a mole within the training programme, he begins to believe his recruiter's warning that nothing is what it seems(n)

Comedy based on Beverly Cleary's series of books, starring Joey King and Selena Gomez.(n)

Comedy based on Megan McDonald's series of children's books, starring Jordana Beatty and Heather Graham.(n)

programme.title: The Harry Hill Movie

programme.title: Picture Perfect
programme.desc: An ambitious executive hires a man to pose as her fiance to give her a stable image at work and attract a colleague who is only tempted by unavailable women. However, her fantasy life soon spirals out of control, leaving her unable to tell the difference between fact and fiction. Romantic comedy, with Jennifer Aniston, Jay Mohr, Kevin Bacon, Olympia Dukakis and Illeana Douglas.(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Feisty heroine Annie and her new boyfriend Alex take a cruise in the Bahamas, but the trip becomes a nightmare when they discover a vengeful computer genius - a former employee laid off because of his terminal illness - is also on board. He has secretly programmed the ship to crash into an oil tanker while he steals a cache of diamonds from the cargo. Action thriller sequel, with Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
programme.desc: In a future ravaged by war, the superhero team makes a desperate last stand against a force of deadly robots. Their only hope is to send Wolverine back in time to the 1970s, to join forces with an earlier version of the X-Men and change the events that started the conflict. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Hugh Jackman, Jennifer Lawrence, James McAvoy and Michael Fassbender.(n)

programme.title: 52 Tuesdays
programme.desc: Premiere. Drama, following sixteen-year-old Billie's reluctant path to independence, which is accelerated when her lesbian mother Jane reveals plans to gender transition and become James. Billie goes to live with her father Tom for a year, so the time she can spend with James is limited to Tuesdays between 4pm and 10pm, but before returning home every Tuesday evening to her father she has secret encounters with two older students in a flat. Starring Tilda Cobham-Hervey and Del Herbert-Jane.(n)

programme.title: Le Havre
programme.desc: An African boy arrives in the French port town as a refugee, and quickly befriends an ageing bohemian who makes ends meet shining shoes. With the aid of his friends and neighbours, the man helps protect his young friend from officials looking to deport him. Comedy drama, starring Andre Wilms, Blondin Miguel and Kati Outinen. In French.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle
programme.desc: A Victorian veterinary surgeon is certified insane after developing the ability to talk to his patients in their own language. Undaunted, he manages to escape from the asylum and embarks on a quest to locate a rare aquatic snail. Oscar-winning musical comedy, with Rex Harrison, Samantha Eggar, Richard Attenborough and Anthony Newley. Songs include Talk to the Animals and I've Never Seen Anything Like It.(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: A paranormal expert moves into a haunted house where his daughter befriends the amiable ghost of a young boy - but things start to go awry when three smelly spooks and two dastardly crooks try to chase the new residents away. Family comedy, starring Christina Ricci, Bill Pullman, Eric Idle, Cathy Moriarty and featuring the voice of Malachi Pearson.(n)

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: An alien who crash-lands on Earth falls in love with a widow after assuming her dead husband's identity as a cover, but the duo are soon fleeing the authorities in a frantic effort to reach an extraterrestrial rescue ship. Sci-fi fantasy romance, directed by John Carpenter and starring Jeff Bridges, Karen Allen, Charles Martin Smith, Richard Jaeckel and Robert Phalen.(n)

programme.title: Vertical Limit

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food

programme.desc: Ina Garten shares her favourite chocolate recipes and chocolatier Brigitte Browney reveals how to get professional results at home.(n)

programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares sweet and savoury rice dishes, including a jambalaya and a classic rice pudding.(n)

programme.desc: Ree Drummond's prepares chicken mozzarella pasta, shrimp scampi for her and the girls, pasta puttanesca for a solo meal and quick shells and cheese for the boys.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin has trouble sleeping and seems too tense - even by the standards that normally apply to him. Aware that Paul knows some relaxation techniques, Anne asks her neighbour for help. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: George is elevated to the status of local celebrity when he disarms a desperate man who produces a gun at the health centre. Invited to join the Neighbourhood Watch scheme by his father-in-law, he begins to wonder how long his new-found popularity will last. Romantic comedy series, starring Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff have a bet on Bren's chances of romance with Tony, but the hapless cook's past finally catches up with her and threatens to ruin any prospects of romance. Meanwhile, Stan is furious with Philippa for failing to save the bulbs from last year's Christmas tree lights. Comedy, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Thelma Barlow, Andrew Dunn, Celia Imrie and Shobna Gulati.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies Spectacle
programme.desc: The making of the double act's TV series, featuring a look at the development of their performing style and how some of the most famous sketches were made.(n)

programme.title: Bob Monkhouse: Million Joke Man
programme.desc: In the concluding episode, Paul O'Grady charts Bob Monkhouse's reinvention as the elder statesman of British comedy from 1994 to his death in 2003, and sees how at the end of his life Bob was performing some of his most outstanding comedic work.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del jumps at the opportunity to decorate the local Chinese restaurant to make a quick profit, and the results are outstanding in more ways than one. Comedy, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK by visiting the Manchester Apollo, where he is joined by Jason Manford, John Bishop, Sarah Millican and Mick Ferry for more stand-up routines.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy believes he has thought of a way to win back Elena's affections as her marriage to Gail approaches. Comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly

programme.desc: The big-collared comedian looks back at classic clips, skits and quips from previous series, including his impression of Britney Spears, send-ups of The X Factor, and `Eric Clapton' turning up in Casualty on a drip.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's TV Burp

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Donut Showdown
programme.desc: Canada-based bakers test their creativity and culinary skills in a series of challenges as they compete against one another to make the best doughnuts.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef shares recipes for dishes that can be made well in advance, including a pollock ceviche, Provencal beef stew and a chocolate and croissant bread-and-butter pudding. Plus, Rachel's friends test a recipe while she takes to the sea with a local fisherman.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Sue Perkins and Mel Giedroyc present as the remaining four bakers take a deep breath and head into the semi-final of the nation's favourite baking contest. However, there's no time to marvel at how far they've come - it's Patisserie Week, and they will need to demonstrate that they have skills worthy enough to see them through to this year's final. The bakers are challenged to make a signature baklava - two types of any flavour they like, before the technical challenge demands they knock up a German Schichttorte, a cake cooked in stages under the grill to create 20 layers of different coloured sponge. Finally, the showstopper sees the semi-finalists baking non-stop to create two entremets in which they should demonstrate as many personal skills and techniques as they can.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the second quarter-final and the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from kitchen scraps, including bones and offcuts, fish skins, overripe fruit, cooked rice, cheese and stale bread. After an elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Tracey MacLeod, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The fifth leg of Si King and Dave Myers' tour takes them to Austria, the home of Mozart, The Sound of Music and Arnold Schwarzenegger. They start off in Vienna, the patisserie capital of the world, where they are spoilt for choice by the number of different cakes on offer. Moving on, they make authentic apfelstrudel with the owner of a roadside B&B, bake Linzertorte, cook breakfast in a monastery and make a chocolate gugelhupf cake for a group of fellow bikers from Huddersfield. Being in the Alps, they also take time out from the cooking to learn how to yodel.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: A pared-down approach to cuisine in which the domestic goddess reveals that what people cook and how they prepare it really can make them feel better and more alive. Nigella prepares her avocado toast with radishes for breakfast, a Thai noodle dish with cinnamon and prawns, and a laid-back family supper of seeded lamb ribs, served with a feta and avocado salad. Nigella also serves her warm-spiced cauliflowers and `chicksalad' and a sweet treat in the form of an apricot almond cake.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: The food writer demonstrates her favourite recipes for sharing with family and friends, including a tray of nourishing breakfast bars, a supper of crunchy chicken cutlets, and a dark and sumptuous chocolate cake. Plus she shows to make succulent belly pork burgers, which were inspired by a visit to a New York eatery.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that summer has to offer, rustling up dishes using the finest available seasonal produce. In the first episode, he visits a local farm that produces welfare-friendly animals, exploring the reasons why members of the British public often feel uneasy about eating veal. He also visits Manchester to extol the success of land-linking website Landshare.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Donut Showdown
programme.desc: Canada-based bakers test their creativity and culinary skills in a series of challenges as they compete against one another to make the best doughnuts.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef creates fuss-free recipes for a fete, including chocolate, toffee and peanut squares, lemon cake, and brown scones with treacle and sesame seeds. She also visits an artisan chocolate-maker and gives members of the Irish Countrywoman's Association a sample of her scones.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off: The Final.
programme.desc: Three contestants remain and only one more weekend of baking stands between them and the 2014 title. Judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry have saved their most fiendish tests till last, as the finalists face a Signature Challenge in which they have just three hours to prove they have mastered a pastry technique that usually takes a whole day. They then have to tackle a Technical Challenge without the aid of a recipe, before rustling up a Showstopper that turns sponge, caramel, choux pastry and petits fours into a winning combination. At least Sue Perkins and Mel Giedroyc are on hand to lighten the atmosphere if it all gets too tense.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The week's first heat sees five more chefs enter the kitchen, with the first challenge giving them an hour to cook a signature dish that showcases what they can do, before one is asked to leave. The remaining four contenders try to impress Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace by preparing mille feuille with creme patissiere and raspberries, and then Marcus Wareing gives them 60 minutes to cook a spectacular lamb dish. Finally, Marcus and Monica decide which three will make it through to the next round.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The duo arrive in Italy, where they abandon their hogs for the gondolas of Venice, and bake a classic focaccia by the side of a canal. They later visit Si King's sister, who lives in Tuscany, and savour a pasta pie in the back streets of Ferrara. There then follows a dash for Turin to help celebrate the country's 150th birthday, a visit to a hazelnut farm to learn the secrets of a certain chocolate spread and the chance to re-create big-screen movie The Italian Job on the rooftop of the old Fiat factory.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigella's simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish that's uplifting to look at, as well as to eat.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson rustles up more of her favourite recipes, this time with the emphasis on cosy and comforting mood. For breakfast she makes a tray of dairy-free chai muffins, while there's a low-key lunch of Asian-flavoured short ribs - a perfect make-ahead, tender beef stew. Inspired by her visits to America's west coast, an informal supper for friends features Nigella's home-made, oven-baked fish tacos, which involve a bit of DIY at the table, followed by a salted chocolate tart for pudding.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and Tim Maddams introduce a `leftovers night' at the canteen, turning a range of foods destined for the compost heap into new dishes including gnocchi, fish canapes and puddings made from breadcrumbs. A visit to Portland Young Offender Institution reveals the success of its vegetable-growing programme, and a nursery-school teacher is shown how to bake bread.(n)

programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: Danny DeVito stars in this thoughtful comedy about Bill Rago, an advertising executive who gets fired from his job and is forced to take on an army job teaching poorly educated boot camp recruits to read. With a little ingenuity, he gets them reading Shakespeare's Hamlet, but finds opposition in the guise of Sgt Cass (Gregory Hines), who dislikes civilians and thinks he is wasting his time teaching screw-ups to think for themselves. Also stars Ed Begley Jr and a young Mark Wahlberg(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Net Neutrality in the U.S. Net neutrality in the U.S.; the American Health Care Act of 2017; and Eminem's court fight with New Zealand's National Party are discussed(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jackie Chan is a perfect fit in this stylish comedy-adventure about a cabbie-turned-chauffeur who fills in for his out-of-commission secret-agent boss by donning a high-tech suit that enables him to foil villains plotting to sabotage the world's water supply. Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar, Ritchie Coster, Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: Magic & Bird: A Courtship of Rivals
programme.desc: The rivalry and friendship between NBA Hall of Famers Larry Bird and Magic Johnson is the focus of this documentary. Included: clips from their college and NBA battles; and interviews with coaches and teammates, including Pat Riley, Kevin McHale and Michael Cooper(n)

programme.title: Storks
