programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Megan Edgcumbe and Dick Stanley host the latest round of the competition at Manor Lodge in Cornwall. Things get off to a good start when the guests find their rooms clean, but later the hostess reveals her upper-class background and a Cumberland sausage causes a stir at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: James and Judith Calderbank invite their fellow competitors to the rural Ashculme House in Devon for the third visit of the week, but the couple's back-to-basics approach does not go down well with all the guests. Workaholic Alfie worries that having no phone signal will affect his business, while competitive Megan and Dick relish finding dust in the outside building.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competitors have great expectations of Kevin Wainwright and partner David Little's Satis House in Suffolk, but the last visit of the week sees old resentments resurface as Megan and Dick eagerly point out faults in the hosts' presentation - including an oversight in their room and overly crispy bacon for breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Alfie and rival owner Megan engage in a debate about breakfasts and heating, while David and Kevin become a little emotional before the week's winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kathy Hector, who hopes to find a holiday home in Antigua, where she used to live. House prices in the Caribbean have dipped in recent years, but Kathy wants a dwelling that will offer a significant rental return.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Hampshire sailing enthusiasts Berto and Angie Janssen look for a holiday home for their family in south Tenerife, and discovers the uncertain global economic climate means their budget of £250,000 can go a long way.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Applecross, Skye: Scotch Broch - Iron Age Life at Applecross.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team tries to excavate one of the largest Iron Age structures in Britain, a stone tower in Applecross, north-west Scotland. Overhead power lines mean mechanical diggers cannot be used, so the tons of rock must be removed by hand, a task made harder by the worsening weather.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Alfoldean in West Sussex, where they believe an uncovered Roman coaching inn is at the centre of a large settlement. A 600-metre trench is dug, but resources are stretched as the experts attempt to find out why the village fell into disuse halfway through the occupation of Britain.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: David and Gill and their son Freddie are hoping Noel Fitzpatrick can help their Labrador Scooby, who has a life-threatening tumour in his leg. The vet goes to extraordinary lengths to save the life of Tiger the cat after his heart stops during his recovery from an operation, and when a lurcher called Otis brought in with shotgun wounds, Noel must extract the bullet before working out how to save the animal's leg. Plus, will a pair of tights help a French bulldog walk again?.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend lead a team of experts who secretly restore classic cars for their unsuspecting owners. They begin by coming to the aid of a bricklayer whose 1986 Ford Sierra RS Cosworth was neglected after a family tragedy.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales embark on more waterway adventures. This time, they head into uncharted waters to attempt one of the longest canal journeys in the world - 350 miles coast to coast across Sweden. The first leg of their voyage begins in Gothenburg, where they link up with the historic Gota Canal, taking them into the heart of the Scandinavian country and toward the Baltic Sea.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: In Worthing, a boy's bedroom receives a makeover, a garden gets a revamp and a lounge is transformed, but it remains to be seen whether potential buyer Christine is bowled over.(n)

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George is joined by leading architects to help transform some of Britain's most unloved houses into desirable properties, beginning with the 1970s home of Tony and Sarah in the Vale of Glamorgan. The couple want rid of the pebbledash facade, small windows and dated decor, to create a great family home on a relatively modest budget of £60,000. They receive some bespoke and cutting-edge input from commercial and residential architect Greg Blee, with a plan that will link their home to the landscape beyond, including a Shard-like extension.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The medical team faces a range of sport and drink-related injuries on a busy Saturday, including two women hurt when the bar they were dancing on collapsed, and a bricklayer badly cut in an attempted mugging. The night's most dramatic case occurs when a father and son are brought in with life-threatening injuries after being attacked by gatecrashers at a family birthday party, one of whom was armed with a samurai sword.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Starkville, Mississippi, to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having more than 40 years' experience in the business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss as to how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work, while his wife Sukie is struggling as its chef, tackling the role without any formal catering experience. Gordon discovers a family tragedy that explains why this couple have become trapped in their business and wrestling with debt.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: In Worthing, a boy's bedroom receives a makeover, a garden gets a revamp and a lounge is transformed, but it remains to be seen whether potential buyer Christine is bowled over.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The medical team faces a range of sport and drink-related injuries on a busy Saturday, including two women hurt when the bar they were dancing on collapsed, and a bricklayer badly cut in an attempted mugging. The night's most dramatic case occurs when a father and son are brought in with life-threatening injuries after being attacked by gatecrashers at a family birthday party, one of whom was armed with a samurai sword.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Sarah Millican, Johnny Vaughan, Jon Richardson and Louie Spence join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jason Manford for the irreverent panel show, in which teams answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kathy Hector, who hopes to find a holiday home in Antigua, where she used to live. House prices in the Caribbean have dipped in recent years, but Kathy wants a dwelling that will offer a significant rental return.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: David and Gill and their son Freddie are hoping Noel Fitzpatrick can help their Labrador Scooby, who has a life-threatening tumour in his leg. The vet goes to extraordinary lengths to save the life of Tiger the cat after his heart stops during his recovery from an operation, and when a lurcher called Otis brought in with shotgun wounds, Noel must extract the bullet before working out how to save the animal's leg. Plus, will a pair of tights help a French bulldog walk again?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B veteran Paul Workman, who runs Hamlet House in Stratford-upon-Avon, makes the most of his town's Shakespeare connection as another round of the competition gets under way - but his guests cause a fuss when a hair is found in the mushrooms at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to B&B novices Ben Gray and Katie Keegan's Ashlack business in Cumbria. The guests admire rooms in the estate's 17th-century manor house, but Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud are unimpressed when they discover their accommodation is a yurt in the woods. Filled with dread at the idea of a midnight trip to the toilet facilities, they later make plain their feelings when checking out.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Richwood in Torquay, where partners Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud run the 13-bedroom guest house by themselves. The diners are given a crash course in belly-dancing and provided with a feast of Lebanese delicacies - but are soon distracted by the dated decor.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Helen Fraser welcomes her guests to the Tai'r Bull Inn in the Brecon Beacons, with moral support from her friend Kath. Ben and Katie are quick to praise the quality of their lodgings, but B&B veteran Paul spots a few mistakes, while Saida and Veronica refuse to spend the night in their room after they make a discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. A clash then ensues between two of the week's hosts before the winner of the competition is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton goes house-hunting in Denia, on Spain's Costa Blanca, for a couple from Exeter who have a budget of £120,000 and want a property they can use for holidays and their eventual retirement.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Time Team: Secrets of a Tudor Mansion.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew visit Chenies Manor in Buckinghamshire to investigate how the house would have appeared in the 16th century when Henry VIII stayed there. An inventory from 1585 lists a host of rooms that are no longer in existence, and the experts' excavations reveal more than a few surprises for the property's current owners.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Nether Poppleton, Yorkshire: The Monastery and the Mansion.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Nether Poppleton near York in a bid to find out more about the village's origins. Residents are recruited to join in the excavations as the experts try to establish whether the settlement, mentioned in the Domesday Book as the land of St Everilda, dates back to the Anglo-Saxons.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick operates on a five-month-old rabbit with a badly broken hind leg and diagnoses that a much-loved cocker spaniel needs major spinal surgery. The `Bionic Vet' also meets young couple David and Khaya, who have brought in a three-legged dog that they adopted from Thailand after it was attacked with a machete. Noel knows he must come up with a radical treatment for the animal's remaining front paw, which is injured, and gains inspiration from X-Men's Wolverine for an innovative solution.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend lead a team of experts as they attempt to renovate a Volkswagen Beetle that has spent many years rusting in a garage.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Stuart and Rosie Treasurer from the Wirral plan to transform a small bungalow from a 1960s dormer into a slick piece of 21st-century architecture. The couple decapitate the building and balance a new floating timber box on top to create five bedrooms, spending as little as possible on plumbing, electrics and insulation, but stress levels spiral when neighbours grumble at the ultra-modern creation.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Chris Moller presents a look at innovative and unusual houses in Ponsonby, Auckland, and checks up on the progress of Sarah and Philippe Lods, who are building a modernist home.(n)

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Mark Evans follows water-loving couple Shirley and Russ, who enjoy kayaking and living on their yacht. Now they want to join a large community of 600 floating homes in Canada, designing a luxury ranch-style home, including wraparound sundecks for year round entertaining, a bar area and pool table on the upper levels. Plus, adventurous retirees Glenn and Margaret build a nautical-themed floating home in a marina on Vancouver's north shore with stunning sea and mountain views, which will allow them to stay close to their family and friends, yet away from the hubbub of inner-city life.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous words-and-numbers quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by Miles Jupp and Greg Davies. Holly Walsh presides alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.(n)

programme.title: Super Bowl XXXIV
programme.desc: This video details the unlikely meeting of the St. Louis Rams and the Tennessee Titans in Super Bowl XXXIV. The Rams, 1999's Cinderella story, overcame their last place finish in 1998 to meet up with the young and ambitious Titans in the closest and most exciting Super Bowl in over a decade. The video pays special attention to Rams quarterback Kurt Warner and his climb from grocery stock boy in Iowa to Arena Football League lackey to Super Bowl MVP. The game footage and the comments from players and sports writers demonstrate the intensity and excitement generated as the game wore down to the last seconds, the outcome not determined until the final play. Super Bowl XXXIV also pays special tribute to long-time NFL coach Dick Vermeil and his last season as a head coach(n)

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Sweet Smell of Revenge. It's week six and the captains of Gloucester, Massachusetts, face unwelcome competition from pleasure boaters and novice fishermen. Nicknamed googans or weekend warriors by the commercial fleet, these amateurs swarm into Gloucester waters, attracted by warm weather and dreams of landing a big tuna. The captains are pushed to breaking point when the blundering newcomers cause them to lose tuna after tuna - costing them potential paydays of up to $20,000 for a single fish(n)

programme.title: Wicked Tuna

A storm is racing towards the North Atlantic fishing grounds, but with time ticking away on the bluefin tuna season, the Gloucester fleet has no choice but to head out to fish in the rough weather. As Mother Nature strikes hard against the captains, each must decide if the risks are worth the rewards when facing off against wind and waves(n)

programme.title: 20 Animals That Will Kill You
programme.desc: Wild animals kill thousands of people every day - and the most dangerous creatures may not be what you think. From Bengal tigers to elephants to mosquitos, animals can kill in a multitude of ways. Predators are obvious killers, but others defend their territory, attack in self-defense, or kill by sheer accident. Wildlife experts break down some of the most revealing attacks caught on tape to expose what animals kill the most people, how they kill, and why(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Winner Takes Off. Having targeted Geoffrey (Joseph Marcell) as a perfect patsy, Will (Will Smith) and Carlton (Alfonso Ribeiro) pull a series of rather nasty practical jokes on the beleagured butler, topping themselves by convincing Geoffrey that he's won a million-dollar lottery. The joke, alas, backfires when Geoffrey, convinced he's independently wealthy, quits his job--but not before telling the Banks family what he REALLY thinks of them, Ultimately, the truth comes out, and the humiliated Geoffrey accepts a restaurant job rather than return to the Bankses--and it's up to Will and Carlton to sheepishly set things right(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a memorable restoration project in the remote Creuse region of central France. Back in 2003, when Denise Daniel and Doug Ibbs gave up everything in the UK to start a new life abroad, they couldn't have known what was ahead of them. Falling in love with a dilapidated manor house with just four crumbling walls and half a roof, they embarked on a mission to transform it - working day and night, doing everything themselves, year after year - until slowly but surely they created a magnificent edifice out of the ruins they bought off the internet. On the 70th anniversary of the destruction of the original 19th-century building by the German army, the house finally took its finished form.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux - Savile
programme.desc: In light of the unmasking of Jimmy Savile as a predatory sex offender, and 15 years on from the BBC documentary When Louis Met Jimmy, Louis Theroux sets out to understand how a man who was at the centre of British entertainment and charitable fundraising for decades was able to get away with a long litany of crimes. Louis talks to some of Savile's victims and people who worked closely with him, and re-examines moments from the original film as well as footage that's never aired before on television.(n)

programme.title: No Offence

With a third girl already missing, the officers - led by the capable but unstable DI Vivienne Deering - face a race against time to rescue her. programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Basildon.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Basildon, Essex, to meet nine-year-old Brandon, who suffers a severe form of epilepsy and can have up to 30 seizures a day. He requires 24-hour care and mum Jenny can't let him out of her sight for a moment - and to make matters worse, the family home simply isn't safe enough for the youngster. Luckily, the local tradesmen have heard of the family's plight and arrive in force to help Nick and the team transform the home, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.desc: The experts fly out to Spain to offer assistance to expatriate amateurs whose projects have gone horribly wrong. Lowri Turner's crew help a retired Halifax couple solve their space problems before their families come to visit, while Nick Knowles and his gang transform a goat shed into a family home, giving it such basics as a roof, bathroom, sitting room and kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Cops
programme.desc: Officers search for a driver who abandoned his car following a crash on an unlit area of motorway that left a trail of devastation. Near Bromsgrove, constables Adam Toal and Paul Owen spot a motorist driving with no lights on and the situation quickly turns into a chase. PCs Dave Gaunt and Kevin Whitehouse stop a Bentley on the M6 that is being driven by a man with more than one identity.(n)

programme.title: Super Rich: The Billion Dollar Hotel
programme.desc: Shaped like a giant sail and standing more than 1,000ft tall, the Burj Al Arab in Dubai cost an estimated £1billion to build, and has been dubbed the world's most luxurious hotel. Guests paying anything up to £10,000 a night expect only the highest of standards, so what does it take for the staff to satisfy these demanding customers? This programme follows the stories of a variety of visitors, from the King of Uganda to a firefighter who has saved up months of wages, and the workers who serve them.(n)

programme.title: Women Behind Bars
programme.desc: The case of Diane Fleming, who was suspected of poisoning her husband Chuck with methanol after his mysterious death in 2000.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The Proactive Squad from Thames Valley Police uses unmarked cars with video cameras on board to give an intriguing insight into car crime and ways it can be prevented. Featuring footage of dangerous drivers on the overcrowded roads.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Police officers use unmarked cars fitted with on-board video cameras, offering an insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented. The programme also features footage of dangerous drivers.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A balding macaque receives protection from his troop's over-enthusiastic grooming, and the park is saddened by the death of alpha male capuchin Tom, who was at the centre for seven years. Elsewhere, the chimps are given walnuts and Jestah gets more than his fair share.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison Cronin springs into action when an adult female chimpanzee in Mexico urgently needs the team's help. Even Lulu joins in the fun when the nursery chimps have a play session, and Kai tries to act independent and grown up while discouraging Amy from joining in his games.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. David investigates the driving forces behind their evolution, exploring the appearance and behaviour of remarkable creatures and vegetation including giant whale sharks, marine iguanas and seemingly normal dandelion seeds that grow into plants the size of trees.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Halloween 4: The Revenge of Rod Skyhook.
programme.desc: The Dunphys try to get Luke's Halloween party going, Cam confronts his Halloween nemesis and Jay plans to go to a party at an old enemy's home to deliver an unforgettable trick.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell is thrown into the spotlight when Cam fails to fill him in on what his play is really about, while Phil threatens to spoil Jay's favourite place in the world when he considers becoming a member.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Pritchett-Tuckers throw a huge Thanksgiving party and Cameron spares no expense, while Jay has to figure out a way to keep his blood pressure down on one of the most stressful days of the year. While Phil tries to get used to Rainer Shine dating his daughter, Hayley has to break it to her dad that she would rather spend the rest of her holiday with her new boyfriend than stay for the traditional family football game.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Hayley's plan for a fun-filled girl's day with Rainer Shine's teenage daughter may be a little more angst-filled than expected, while Luke finds himself in a compromising position with a widow at the club, and unwittingly helps Jay with his petition. At the Pritchett-Tucker home, Gloria, Phil and Cam have formed a secret alliance to ensure their respective mistakes are concealed from their spouses, but Mitchell starts suspecting something just isn't right.(n)

Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)

programme.desc: McGarrett and Wo Fat escape from prison, but the NLM gunmen aren't far behind, while terrorists pin down the location of Kono and Adam's safehouse, storm the Five-0 headquarters and take everyone hostage. Elsewhere, light is shed on Doris's relationship and a new SWAT captain arrives in town. Guest starring Henry Ian Cusick, with Alex O'Loughlin and Chi McBride.(n)

programme.sub-title: A'ale Ma'a Wau (Fish Out of Water).
programme.desc: The team crosses paths with a tough Texas Ranger who arrives on the island in search of his missing daughter. Kono and Adam's security is compromised and Catherine receives a job offer from an old friend. Crime drama, starring Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan and Michelle Borth.(n)

programme.desc: The case involving Arkady and his personal connection to the oil tanker leads Callen, Sam, Deeks and Kensi to Moscow, where the team must assume multiple undercover identities to locate the suspects. programme.desc: Part one of two. programme.title: Supergirl

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: With no alternative and nothing left to lose, Barry takes on Savitar in a final showdown. Superhero adventure, starring Grant Gustin, with Andre Tricoteux. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Force: Essex
programme.desc: Documentary shining a light on modern policing in the county of Essex and the challenges faced by officers as they deal with a range of criminal and social issues.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Ben Fogle presents the documentary exploring the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out how destructive high-speed winds can be through a series of spectacular reconstructions.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush and Jeffries investigate a 1945 case involving baseball star Clyde Taylor, who was subjected to a violent attack following a game and beaten to death with his own bat. Drama, with Kathryn Morris and Thom Barry.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The medic tends a construction worker brought in after a fall, and notices the man's fingers are turning purple - a symptom the accident could not have caused. As the team tries different medications, the patient's condition deteriorates and his hand begins to rot - leaving no choice but to amputate. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate the theft of a famous car that was driven by Steve McQueen in the classic film Bullitt, now owned by Owen Cairo. Elsewhere, Erin clashes with Frank when she takes sides with her boss. Police drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When Thomas Wilder, a serial killer Danny has been unable to apprehend, threatens him and his family, Linda's concern over her husband's job and the state of their marriage intensifies. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor travels to some of the world's most luxurious hotels and explores the varied aspects of the hospitality industry. He begins by examining the roles power and money play in the business, checking into Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, California's Barkley Pet Hotel and the $44,000-a-night Ty Warner Penthouse at the Four Seasons in New York.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: When it is discovered that a recently deceased elderly woman had been using someone else's identity for decades, Rush reopens the 1954 case of a housewife who was committed to a mental institution for almost killing her son after setting a house fire. Crime drama, with Kathryn Morris and Diane Ladd.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The maverick medic treats a stubborn and egotistical doctor who has fallen ill while dispensing tuberculosis medicine in Africa. Ron Livingston guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough employs the latest technologies to explore the violence, rivalries and deadly weaponry existing within the world of bugs. This first episode examines the survival tactics of its terrifying residents including killer ants, trap-setting spiders and beetles with the ability to shoot boiling chemicals at their enemies.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues his bug-eyed view of the world of creepy-crawlies, revealing how predators defuse the defences of their prey. Highlights include the cockroach wasp, busy preparing a tasty - and very live - treat for its young, the whirligig beetle, which employs a water-based radar system, and the jumping portia spider, which feeds on other arachnids.(n)

programme.desc: Twenty five years after the investigation into Laura Palmer's murder, the mystery returns. Written by the original creators David Lynch and Mark Frost.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: A history of the British Isles from ancient times to the present day, featuring re-enactments of major events and historic turning points. The series begins in 58 AD and reveals how the arrival of a 10,000-strong Roman army changed England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland for ever. The programme also explores the achievements of early Britons, including the construction of Stonehenge, and explores social structures that held sway before the invasion.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In this edition, he focuses on floods and the damage they can cause.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of London's most famous markets. He begins with a fry-up breakfast before visiting the remains of a Roman amphitheatre and investigating a mysterious secret in a Liverpool Street hotel, as well as meeting former EastEnders star Larry Lamb (Archie Mitchell).(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores Newcastle, discovering strange sounds by the river and finding out how traditional culture is being reinterpreted in the Byker district. He goes behind the scenes at Newcastle United with local football hero Peter Beardsley, learns about the history of adult comic Viz from former editor Simon Donald and accompanies comedienne Sarah Millican to her favourite part of the city.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A diary is discovered on a recycled computer, prompting Rush to reopen investigations into a woman's death. The victim had briefly enjoyed success as an internet millionaire before dying in 1999, seemingly of a stress-induced heart attack. Her main programmer is suspected of being somehow involved, but he has an airtight alibi. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The misanthropic doctor treats a student who is suffering electric shocks inside his body. The team wonders whether the man's symptoms are connected to a holiday in Jamaica - but it is not until his father reveals the nature of the family business that the real reason becomes clear. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank's first partner announces plans to publish a book filled with stories of their early days on the force, prompting the police commissioner to worry his personal secrets might be about to be made public. programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A mobster is found shot in his car, with his low-level errand boy tied up in the trunk. Meanwhile, an NYPD officer asks for a new shield number - the same one as Frank's deceased son Joe. Crime drama starring Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while there's no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself.(n)
